Summary: The cleanest rooms ever. Clean linen, clean bathrooms, clean towels all 6 nights we stayed. Front desk polite professional. Cleaning staff friendly and hard workers. Safe location, no hobos or such around the property. Safe normal tourists. The free breakfast pastry, bread, fruit, cold cereal, milk and juices. Kept clean. Decent beds and pillows. Clean fridge and microwave. Downside no safe. Yet i would come back here everytime hands down.

This is our fourth time staying there. The rooms were clean and very nice. The staff was great and it was close to Disneyland and Huntington Beach. That was our goal with the four-year-old. This is his first time ever traveling. Thank you to the great staff and it was a pleasure

Motel is clean, staff is very friendly and helpful.  If you find yourself in Anaheim near Knoxberry Farms I would highly recommend this motel.  So if you are wanting inexpensive but high quality this is the place for you.

The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and the location was close to restaurant and the drive to Disney wasn't bad. Overall it was a great experience for the price and location.

the best thing is location from Disneyland less that 15 minutes, in these kind of hotel breakfast usually are poor, we cant expect variety in these proprieties,  but in general term is a good relation price-quality, check always flexible rates and use WYNDHAM REWARDS !

We chose this place on the fly heading to Disneyland. It is very close to Disney. So close you can hear the fireworks like they are in the parking lot. This place isn’t worth your money. No service. Maid left clean towels on request but didn’t clean. No breakfast though advertised. Mold on ceiling. Ac was turned off when we got there.

Because of the location if the inn, I was pleasantly surprised how relaxing, safe and comfortable I felt.  The rooms were quite clean, beds extremely comfortable.  Housekeeping staff were very polite and courteous.

Summary Heading: They will keep the money of your deposit!
Summary: We have been trying to get our deposit night refund for more than two months and they keep telling us that our bank is not accepting the money. We have called several times to the hotel and the response is the same, our bank explains that whenever money is coming in to an account, they never block the operation. Be aware of that and don´t move away from the hotel unless you get your money refunded at the time.

Location is great but the Internet has an issue in the room. Easy to go access all amenities.   Room carpet was dirty but room was sanitized  Worth for the price and location  Breakfast is great. Guest service is very friendly

Hotel is in a good distance from Disney Park. The room was small and the carpet was dirty. The mattresses were old and not comfortable at all.  The breakfast was the worse. They had cold cereal, toast no hot food. The washer was close by 5pm.

Summary Heading: A great affordable clean and safe pick while in Anahiem
Summary: Stayed here for 6 days and nights and it was excellent.  The price could not be beat.  I t was clean, safe and had all the needed amenities on a reasonable budget.  Loved the pool and hot tub.  I would stay here again.  For the amount of time you spend in the room there is no reason to spend so much on a fancy hotel.  This place was great.  The service was excellent and most of all the sleep was great, the AC was great, internet worked, enough towels.  Literally no complaints.

This is a clean little hotel in a central location near Knotts Berry Farm parks and down from the main freeway. There are several restaurants and a Walmart nearby. Nice larger in room refrigerator. They had daily room service and grounds maintenance. Check in and check out was fast and easy. It felt clean and safe.

I really enjoyed our time and stay there. I would surely revisit in the future stays. The 12 noon checkout is perfect. I appreciate everything that the staff offered during our stay I hope that your stay is as pleasant as our stay.

The location of this Days Inn at 800 S. Beach Blvd. left much to be desired.  Although it was close to Knotts Berry Farm, it is also where women of the night work the streets.  We actually saw 2 women working just 1 block from this hotel.  Later we observed the police back up in the middle of the street to catch another women who must have been working, too.

Summary Heading: Spend the extra money to stay somewhere else
Summary: The extra $40/night you pay to stay somewhere else will be worth every penny. Unless you enjoy rooms where you can hear every noise including housekeeping vacuuming at the crack of dawn, the smell of old cologne, sweat and cigarettes, and a complimentary “breakfast” of fruit loops, granola bars and a bag of wonder bread + broken toasters.

Disney birthday trip Room was a nice size and beds were comfy...pool and hot tub were colder than necessary. Staff and food options were not great...property does not offer tea options or laundry detergent

Mattress littered all over property,  hallway to room smelt like urine, room was run down, blood/snot on curtains, ants in the bathroom. Dark dingy room, carpets were filthy. 10/10 wouldn't reccomend. We had our family and there was no way I was letting my kids stay in such a disgusting place. Pool was disgusting and green, drug users all over, people living at the hotel with animals etc.

You are ideally situated to visit all of the Parks/Attractions. The area isn't that comfortable to go for an evening walk, but after a day out, you probably aren't going to. The rooms are clean, although the air conditioning is loud and the bed very hard. Daily housekeeping is nice during covid, as it is not offered in all Hotels at this time. There is a laundry, but only 2 washers and dryers and they cost $1.25 each. The pool was open but we did not use it. The free breakfast offered enough to start the day off and had the best orange juice I have tasted in a Hotel in a very long time. I would not hesitate staying here again.

I needed 2 adjoining rooms with connecting door in between. I was informed such rooms were available at the property and if I called the morning of the check-in, they would assign them to me. I called the morning of, 7am; I was informed it was too early. I called later. I was told only after someone checks out, they can assign them to me. I called again later. This time, they assigned me adjoining rooms with connecting door. Sigh of relief, only to check in around 6pm and finding out that one of the 2 rooms was later blocked by the manager, so I could not have them anymore. No one bothered to call me or text me to inform me of the change. Even though I had put in special request, even though I had explained to them multiple times that I was traveling with my mother and needed

Decent place to stay. Ask to be off the main road as it is noisy.  Wifi did not work, they will not give you a late check out although check out is 12pm noon.  If you have any concerns, they give you a card to email the manager. Not a very efficient means to a solution,

Don’t waste your money It’s very old and dirty not at all what you expect from a Wyndham property extremely disappointing reminded me of a very very low budget motel I’m surprised Wyndham properties allows the use of their name on this DUMP

We stayed there for 3 nights. Room was clean and the price was reasonable. The only thing I didn’t like was the wifi internet connection was not very good. Breakfast was ok. Will stay there again. Great location for our needs.

Summary Heading: Dirty sheets; Room Smelled of smoke & Urine
Summary: We left as soon as we walked in the room. Smelled like cigarette smoke and urine. Sheets had grease looking stains all over them. location is sketchy. We ended up leaving immediately and finding a new hotel to stay at. I Do not recommend this place

Summary Heading: Only stay for a night then run!
Summary: The wifi didn't work, our hotel room door did not close properly, the room was dirty, there were about three power-outlets in the whole room, the alarm clock did not work. The hotel is in a very dangerous area and there was no safety precautions (good lighting, attentive employees, etc.). The parking lot was practically always full so parking was a nightmare and strangers who were not staying at the hotel wandered around the parking lot, playing music and revving their cars' engines all night and early into the morning. The phone and coffee machine in our room were also broken, so we had to walk to the front desk every time we had an issue, which also felt dangerous because of the poor security and lack of employees around the hotel at all times.

Summary Heading: The Ants Were Horrible, Hospitality Was Worse
Summary: I made this reservation solely for a place to sleep.  I wasn't looking for perks or special amenities, but the room actually came with one: ants.    A hotel this close to both Knotts' Berry Farm and Disney should come replete with great costumer service and a nice room.  Instead, my first night I found myself being bitten by tiny black ants to the point that I had to sleep on top of the other bed and alternate back and forth to avoid the onslaught.  Wow, this is not something that I would expect, but the hospitality desk will surely help.  Enter Henry.  Henry is the "hospitality clerk."  He is equal parts recalcitrance and aloofness.  I presented my problem to him, to which he neither apologized nor showed any sign of caring.  He stated that I could either stay in the room after

Comfortable room with a centralized location for our visit. Property appearance is adequate but the room made the stay. Mattress was very comfortable and staying at the back of the property made the noise level very limited.

Room was dirty! Smelled like pet urine. Clear substance smeared all over headboard. Was told they were sold out and nothing they could do. Was told to put sheet over headboard! Never again will I ever stay again!

Summary Heading: Stay at days inn by Wyndham Anaheim near the park.
Summary: Very small place. Bathroom towels look nasty. No ice bucket in the room. Slow cable box. Internet connection was unsecured. Not worth how much they charge. They should be charging less. No parking permits needed

My fist  stay was pleasant. I liked it and everything is good until the nose stared distracting me. there is a door between two rooms. I dont know what was doing that next door guest, Keep throwing something to the door or wall or someone was falling, It wasnt peaceful evening and night.

We were originally put in a room by the road that was very noisy. I complained and they moved us to a much quieter room. The rooms are big and clean but basic. Don’t expect luxury but it’s pretty good for the price. The breakfast lady was rude but the reception staff were nice. It’s definitely an average hotel that I would stay in again if it was cheap.

This property is near everything fun in Anaheim.  The rooms were surprisingly comfortable and clean. The only bothersome part was the overflowing dumpster. But all in all the hotel was top notch for the price paid.

Request a special needs room for greater comfort.  Also call in advance to request a room in the middle and not at the end.  It is three levels and has one elevator which is kind of slow.  There are two stairwells on each end of the property.

The evening we checked in 1/18 the young lady at the desk was quite unhelpful and unfriendly. But the graveyard shift guy was super nice. Also the next day 1/19, the two boys working were outstanding and super friendly. One came to fix our tv. The big problem was the remodel in a close room resulting in a big headache with the pounding nonstop all day. We weren’t given anything except an explanation about the remodel. Very very disappointed except for the 3 gentlemen at the front desk. Wouldn’t stay again.

Nice place to stay but wifi was terrible. At no time was I able to connect. Overall it was a nice hotel that meet our needs. When I travel I need to have access to internet due to my business needs. I found myself having to go out of my way to connect.

When reading the reviews people complained of the cleanliness. The room was clean, hot water and the beds were comfy. It was nice to have the couch and table to sit at too. Location was perfect -we had Knotts Berry Farm 2 minutes in one direction and Disney 5 minutes in the other. Lots of places around for food. We had a very late arrival but they were ready for us. We did have a first floor room so lots of kids running around but didn't hear them until people were packing up in the morning. It was nice to have the fridge and microwave in the room. Only gripes: the shower head is low, so if you're over 5'6 you're going to be doing squats. And the toilet is very low to the ground.

Apparently you pay for what you get  This place with beyond disgusting. The sheets were dirty for crying out loud. It was awful!   There is also a problem with parking. There is not enough if it.  When housekeeping comes and cleans the Room and you see that there is no more toilet paper common sense leave a roll!

Room clean & well organized Everything was perfect. This time our trip to Disneyland  was very good because we could sleep confortable at night (Not like hotel 6 across the street.) Totally a nightmare

I would give ZERO stars if I could after the fact that they are lying on me & NOT giving me my deposit back. They are CLAIMING that I smoked in my room while having my son with me in my room the ENTIRE time... I barely even stayed there. This was a SCAM. They took my money & falsely accused me of SMOKING IN MY ROOM with my KID all because I had thrown something away in the TRASH! These people are the low of the low, taking peoples money & holding it under FALSE claims. I DO NOT SMOKE IN CLOSED QUARTERS OR EVEN NEAR MY CHILD.

We usually don't stay this far away when we go to Disneyland but the price was right and it's a short Lyft ride away.   Check-in was easy and very fast. The room was spacious and clean. We were very surprised at how comfortable the beds were as they are usually just awful. The AC worked great and kept the room nice and cool.    The one and only problem was the shower. While the bathroom was clean the showerhead was very low. I had to hunch a little to wash my hair and I am only 5 ft 6 in. So a 6ft guy is going to have a pretty hard time.    Other than that we enjoyed our stay and would stay again!

I've stayed in some pretty nasty hotels before out of desperation (and lack of money), and this one was insanely cheap for the Disneyland area, but I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. The room was clean, the property looked well maintained, there were no clogged shower drains or dodgy toilets, etc. The bathroom smelled *slightly* musty/mildewy, but not enough to bother me. I never walk in bare feet on hotel carpet so I can't comment on the cleanliness there but they looked fine.   I've seen people complain about the breakfast but I thought it was pretty standard for a cheap motel continental breakfast. Muffins, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, a waffle maker...if that's not good enough for you, the rooms have a microwave and mini fridge in them (both clean!) so you can

Even if you clean up they keep your deposit. Make up some sort of fake “charge” and keep your deposit. It was cash and that is why he was so shady. He wouldn’t give me a receipt. It was dirty. Small. And the desk was rude and WAY over priced. There are MUCh Better places elsewhere VERY close by.

The services was great, and that is a definite plus.  The rooms are a bit dated and dark, but comfy.  The breakfast is good especially for complimentary, just wish everything didn't have raisins in it, or at least plain options to go with it i.e. bagels, cereal, pastries, etc.  The price is good.

Clean comfortable. Only weird thing was coming into the room and it was stifling but that was only because the heat was blasting. But we turned it to cool and left for dinner and beach time. When we came back it perfectly cool. I am in the travel industry so picky yes but I just need a comfy clean bed, clean room, quiet room and area ( tucked away between a hotel row and plenty of restaurants) Overall I was pretty happy with the stay. I think the front desk staff lacked a little enthusiasm but they still did their job and that's ultimately what Is most important to me.

My mom lives nearby, and we cannot stay with her when we visit from NorCal.  Days Inn was clean, the room was nice, the staff was friendly, and we enjoyed our stay.  We will stay here again when we visit later this year.

Great friendly staff Location great Quite surroundings Off road parking Clean swimming pool and spar Staff on reception very helpful  Rooms cleaned every day Hall ways moped and cleaned every day Breakfast food fresh every day

Summary Heading: You need to understand what it is, and isn't
Summary: Firstly, it very much depends on your reason for stay. My family and i have activities booked everyday, therefore are in the hotel very little. We booked to adjoining rooms and found the rooms, clean (maids everyday), comfortable beds and a bathroom with shower and bath. What was particularly help for us, was parking was not an issue (you don't want to be driving around looking for a spot at midnight!)   If you are looking for a gut busting breakfast, this isn't the place for you. Again it's basic, but if I am in a location for 2 weeks, I don't want bacon and eggs everyday. With a selection of today cereal, free tea and coffee that is fine.   The room also has air conditioning that is good at maintaining and cooling the rooms (essential in July and August), prior have complained

Summary Heading: Good value clean cheap and cheerful
Summary: Cheap and clean. Everything worked and the room and bathroom was clean and well maintained. The pool area was clean and nice. Breakfast was surprisingly good with the make your own waffles tasty and nice.

Clean room, bathroom was clean. Beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only five miles to Disneyland, about 30 minutes to Los Angeles, Ca. There was a CVS and Walmart Neighborhood Market within two blocks of the hotel.

The room was not clean trash in the drawer. Leaves on the carpet. The shower was broken and too 2 hours to fix. Breakfast is ok but you want to be early once they run out you’ll have to buy it or live with what is left or go somewhere else. Staff is nice but not sure if that makes up for it.

I stayed here for a few nights in June the property was clean and they had good amenities except for the internet which is horrible and some of their breakfast staff are rude and disrespectful whenever I tried to talk to her she Just never listened.

Overall the room are nice it's a good place if your just looking for a place to sleep. Don't stay on the bottom level it had red ants in the bathroom. People are very friendly at the service desk. Breakfast not much to choice from no meat or eggs. Close to Knock berry farm.

We stayed at this Days Inn on our trip to America for Halloween. It is really well situated, very easy to get to Disneyland and Knots Berry Farm. We used public transport most of the time we were there and it was easy to navigate the public transport system from there. It costs $5 for an all day ticket and combined with the app on the phone where it tells you which stop to get off at and where and how far to walk to the next stop made it real easy. One bus takes you all the way to Huntington beach and some brilliant shopping malls.  The hotel itself is fine. We found it clean, the pool is awesome after a days getting around- is not heated but that's fine when you're in a hot country.  The staff are all really helpful too, very informative about the area and how to get anywhere.

It would be my husband and my two grandchildren on a trip to Disneyland .  We got good rest but the tub wouldn’t hold any water so my grandchildren had a baby with the water running we booked for people but we’re only given two towels but overall we called about the towels it got resolved quickly the tub did not but the service was very good .

The sink had zero pressure.  There was only one waffle maker for up to 20 people.  Long lines and they ran out of the waffle mix and no other breakfast items available including any coffee.  This was at 8 o'clock in the morining.  The front desk clerk was told but he ignored us.  He was a tall bald man who had a passive agressive attitude.  The daily housekeeping was good but the floors were filthy.  Groups of very loud Asian tourists come in late and make it difficult to sleep. I would not recommend this place to anyone.  Try the lower cost motels around the Buena Park area.  They may be farther from Disneyland but better accomodations with nicer desk clerks.  Also, be careful that they do credit you back with the $50 mandatory deposit on your credit card.  They may forget and

The room needs severe plumbing maintenance!! Curtains had stains all over them and the tv never worked! Reiterated the issues to the front desk at checkout. Very disappointed in the property and in their customer service.

Summary Heading: Perfect when you're on a budget
Summary: pros: ~ huge bathroom tub  ~ only 15 min drive to Mickey & Friends Disneyland Parking Structure ~ free parking ~ free breakfast ~ microwave in room ~ mini fridge in room  Con: ~ thin blanket & sheets ~ access to door is from the outside  Perfect room if you're on a budget in Anaheim.

Breakfast only have bread and jam, cereals, not good quality . Location is ok, but on busy street. Room  I got was on the street side ...was noisy whole night.  Breakfast need improvement as we were not satisfied with it at all.

I was just looking for a cheap hotel to stay for 4 nights. The review was so and so and some really bad glad i ignore them. In fairness to Days Inn, my 2 queen size bed was acceptable. Get a booking reservation directlly to Wyndham at $63 per night. Hotels.com, booking.com, expedia etc were all in the above $69 per night range. so cheaper if you straight to daysinn.com housekeeping was good in cleaning my room every day. there was a little peculiar smell in the room i dont know what but got used to it after second day. free coffee, micro wave and fridge helps me stock with food. parking free right in front of my room. hot water for shower is good. i brought my slippers so review was so bad walking on barefoot or with with socks so i dont know what to say about it but i did not

Summary Heading: Pleasant Little Hotel with Friendly Staff
Summary: When we first arrived we thought we were an awfully long distance from Disneyland.  However the next morning we walked one block to Ball Avenue or Road, and from there took the Number 46 bus to Harbor Blvd.  This cost $2 and took about 20 minutes.  Once off, we walked up the hill to the main gates, which took about 15 minutes.  The hotel staff are friendly, and helpful in providing directions if asked.  The breakfast is pretty average, and nothing to rave about, but I was quite happy with a banana and bowl of raisin bran.  The room and bathroom were clean and the TV was of good quality.  Wi fi comes and goes due to high traffic, and the pool isn't heated.

We reserve two rooms. One room smells moldy I was disgusting and when we arrived the beds had not been made and the room was still dirty. The second room had cockroaches. The breakfast was not as advertised. We arrived a half hour after breakfast started to be served and they were out of everything and after waiting nearly 45 minutes for the staff to replace the items we left and went to a restaurant. This hotel had the horrible smell of pot everywhere. I thought the staff was rude. I would not recommend this hotel price was too high the rooms were disgusting they lacked enough breakfast to serve even the people who arrived early and the fact the rooms were stinky and have cockroaches. In my room there was a part of the carpet that had a dip in it and I would twist my ankle if I

Summary Heading: Good personal meeting, good clean rooms
Summary: Good locattion for us, good quality overall.But breakfast was  bad for us having lactos intolerans and gluten. Nice beds and pillows and lean rooms. Im coming back. I hav stayed at his hotel 2 weeks every year since 1998.

Rooms are clean, comfortable, and have amenities such as: blow dryer, iron, microwave, sofa bed, fridge, and brand new air conditioner. The property is well kept and they have a clean pool, the staff is very kind. Overall it’s an excellent value.

This was a wonderful place to visit with my family! very good food around this hotel. definitely will take my family and friends back here soon! I loved the breakfast, and the beds were very comfortable.

The service was good, I can't complain about the rooms, the free breakfast wasn't as good as it could have been, but my friends and I went down and had a snack and we did last until lunch so there are enough options to make it through your morning so... it served it purpose. The pool is good, it is in a great area of Anaheim and we didn't drive hardly at all until we went to the beach which is only a few minutes further. If you're headed to Disney Land, this is honestly a great budget hotel, and for the price, we didn't expect an impeccable stay, but it was a great deal and a good stay. We weren't looking for anything expensive because we were just looking for a place to sleep at night because we knew we would be gone all day, so if you're in that boat, this is a great place to

Staff needs to pay much more attention to detail when processing a reservation..  Had strange man enter room @ night due to front desk not having me located in the correct room. Breakfast was very good.

Thinking a days in would be good but it wasn’t the room was gross hair all over the table and floors. The fridge needed to be defrosted we couldn’t use the freezer at all. The pool had a broken handle to get into it. I had to ask for wash cloths every day they brought hand towels....

Very nice place to visit. and great price. Clean and very helpful employees, they were very helpful with giving us directions to Disneyland.and places to eat. I would use them again to visit California.

I refuse to go back. Management is horrible and  they honestly don't care. Anna is rude and she gets a check regardless so she talks to you crazy. She also will charge your card and claim bath towles are stained.

Summary Heading: Irresponsible with personal info! Pool smells
Summary: I stayed here for one night with my husband and two small kids three weeks ago, and at some point my driver’s license was lost on the property.   I didn’t realize it until I got home (3 hrs away) the next day.  This has never happened to me so obviously, I was very concerned.  I called the hotel ASAP to see if perhaps I had left it at the desk when I checked in UNDER MY NAME. The person I spoke to said “Oh, yeah! It has been sitting here at the front desk.” I asked where they found it on the property and when. I also asked why they didn’t contact me when they found it because the room was under my name. “I don’t know” was the answer to every reasonable question I asked. So, I asked the guy to please copy it, keep the copy, and mail the license back to me.  I asked for the

Extremely disappointed by the hotel service. First of all, upon check in for our 2 night stay, we requested to have the payment split in two cards. The front desk denied the request claiming that they can only use one payment form. This is the first time that not only a hotel, but any business, has refused to split payment. Second, I got charged a deposit to my card, not a hold, an actual charge, which to this date, has not been refunded. After calling the hotel, they mentioned that it could take up to 14 days to be refunded. Additionally, when i asked for an email to send feedback to the manager, I was provided with a GMAIL personal email address for Tony Li Feng. Not a days inn, hotel or any company email a personal email. When I brought that to their attention, they said that

From check in to check out and all in between this hotel exceeding my modest expectations , equalling higher rated properties I have stayed at elsewhere, including similar properties near Disney on Katella Avenue.  The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful and friendly.  The included breakfast was acceptable for the price range.  The room was large, this being an old Ramada property.  There was adequate parking and the whirlpool/swim pool was fine and clean.  The near Knotts Berry Farm  location in the midst of many competing hotels is persfect and safe.  Traffic to and from it is not excesive this time of year.  Room was clean, as was the  bathroom.  The lobby computer worked well.  The wifi worked well.  i will stay here again when in Anaheim.
My room did not get cleaned even after I let the front desk know this was an issue. I even emailed the manager and nobody responded.

Nice room, comfortable and clean. We were only in for one night because our kids got sick, but they only charged for the night we stayed as long as we checked out by noon which was so helpful to us. Definitely will stay there again.

We had a room on the first floor and we thoroughly enjoyed the quiet at this hotel. We didn’t try the breakfast here but it looked fine. The rooms were clean and no bed bugs. The rooms  are a tad small but adequate for a single or couple. We liked the fridg and microwave in the room. Parking was pretty much next to the room. The staff were excellent and very accommodating. We appreciated things that work like an ice machine. There is a lot to see along this street including knots berry farm and close proximity to Newport Beach. Walmart and Costco are also close by for convenience
I asked for a room downstair and my brother an I got Room 107. Very good option for  a lot of shopping with less mobility.

The hotel room was clean and cozy. Comfortable beds. Pillows a little flat however. Great water pressure in the shower. The staff were nice. Pool and hot tub were clean and maintained. I was pleased to see there was a handicap lift for the pool and hot tub for those who needed it. The breakfast was cereal, waffles, pastries and toast. The overall look of the hotel was maintained. The location felt safe. Walking distance to Glee's donuts and burgers as well as other food spots. Close to Knotts Berry Farm,  Midevil times and Pirates dinner. Not to far to Disneyland.  Easy to drive to or inexpensive to use lyft.

Summary Heading: IF you like mold and smelly rooms this is the place for you
Summary: The only reason I stayed at the place was because I was using a "free voucher" from a timeshare gift and this was the hotel choice with the package.  If the opportunity were given to me again, I would decline.  We tried to stay out of the room all day and only come back at night to sleep.  Which still makes my skin crawl thinking about it now.  There were a few cracks in the shower and I saw 2 small roaches go in and out of it.  We sprayed the room down with Lysol and I even brought my own sheets and towels and face clothes.  The bed is uncomfortable, the room has an old unpleasant odor.  If none of this bothers you, than this is the place for you to go.  The WIFI connection would drop as soon as you get connected.  I could go on and on, just glad I survived the trip without

Summary Heading: EXTREMELY NOISEY!!! And staff doesn't care.
Summary: Good size rooms, clean., has microwave and refrigerator but.....ITS SO INCREDIBLY LOUD!, it's past 11pm and it seems the water pipes have problems because every person that takes a shower, not just the people above me but all around my room, the pipes scream! I called the front desk to find out if all the rooms are this loud. He said he didn't know what in was talking about and that he never gets complaints about the rooms being loud. I told him my room was so loud I could hardly hear him, he said "Are you having problems with your phone?"  If you can handle extremely loud noises, from pipes to thin walls, this place is great.

The room was clean and nice. The bidet was out of order, but we didn’t even know we were getting one in our room! I was a little put off by having to pay a $50 deposit; like they just don’t trust you, but it was to make sure we did not smoke in the room, so it wasn’t a problem. Everything else was great.

All the doors says non-smoking. Our room smelled horrible. Maybe it used to be a smoking room and they haven’t gotten the smell out. I took a nap and was coughing frequently afterwards. It’s noisy but otherwise decent.
The room was a good value for those on a budget. The free breakfast was nice. The WiFi was so slow it was unusable.
Everything is fairly close. Away from heavy traffic. Breakfast cereal and banana was fine. Nice place for the money

Room was good for a family birthday celebration before going to Disneyland----even very convenient after coming from Disneyland when members of the family was very exhausted.  The breakfast (2 mornings) were excellent and handy to have before departure.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay here with your family and our breakfast. I hope you come again for your next trip to Disneyland!  Best, Tony General Manager

Summary: Even though we just stayed one night we were very pleased with the accommodations. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! I'm glad that you were pleased with our hotel and would stay again.  Best, Tony General Manager

Summary: We stayed here the weekend before Thanksgiving.  We needed a handicap accessible room and were given one in spite of late arrival.  The room was super clean with a large fridge, great tv with multiple channels, and the room itself was easily large enough to accommodate our group and wheelchair without having to rearrange the furniture. The bathroom was AWESOME!  Zero entry shower, accessible sink, and ADA toilet. The staff was very friendly and willing to help us find our way around. This place is a little off the beaten path but most definitely worth the trip. You guys rock!

room was on end of the building next to washing machines->very noisy, no WiFi, no water in the bathtub/shower. Walls very thin->one could follow neighbors converdations! Asked for different room but no dice! Got 10% discount on the rate after daily complains. Will NOT return here

Summary Heading: Excellent Motel, area & service for a dated property
Summary: Housekeeping was excellent and I expressed that to them, their Supervisor and Front Desk Staff.  A couple friendly suggestions:  Room #326 needs more than one small wastebasket and a soap dish for hand soap rather than laying it o the counter.  Comfortable bed and Easy chair.  I found the tub walls quite high to step in and out of.  A wall handle would be helpful as the remodel is not a tub, but a 2.5 or so wall making a tub.  Thanks for making our 7 night stay so comfortable!

1. Smelled like it hadn't been cleaned in a while 2. Bugs 3. Dirty sheets (we found hair under the pillows and on the sheets) 4. Some sort of thick mystery smudge on the wall that kind of looked like a big booger  You can find the same quality hotel for cheaper. We won't be staying here again.

This is an OK hotel. Rooms are small but clean. Pool was under repair which was quite disappointing to my children. Continental breakfast was pretty basic. Very reasonably priced and close to Disneyland.

This hotel and the staff is not upfront about deposit policies. We called the night before about the deposit inquiring if it could be made with cash and were told yes. When we arrived to the hotel we discovered that while yes, they do take cash deposits, it is for double the amount. This was not mentioned on the phone at all and the supervisor on staff did not care at all and was completely unwilling to do anything to help remedy the situation. We were also charged for one nights stay before arrival (which was never mentioned in our booking confirmation under policies) and then for our entire stay on top of that. For nearly a week, we were charged for one extra night to our account. Staff was completely uninterested in accommodating or rectifying anything that was occurring do

This hotel is not bad for the price we paid. We signed up for wyndham points and got a free item from the front desk. And also we used our insurance membership to get kore discount! Their pool was under renovation, we did not even knew that until we checked in. They gave us discount for that which I think was nice of them. Break fast was average, very simple. Location was great too! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Although I think they need to change their carpets to tiles or regular floorings. Carpet was a little damp when we came and coming from the beach, it can get really dirty.

Summary Heading: I expected better from Wyndham Hotel Group
Summary: Refrigerator stopped working, there was no one to fix or replace it. The pool was under some type of construction, there was no water in it.  No dip in the pool for us... There were bugs in room. Hot water was on the wrong side of he shower..

Horrible unsafe hotel, door didn’t shut all the way, staff rude and unprofessional, nasty stuff on pillow case. Wouldn’t let me check in until I parked in parking lot-not under “checking canopy”. Creepy man browsing the parking lot all night, smelled weed multiple times, no pool, shower curtain was gross, carpet was gross, housekeeping knocked at 7 even though I’d asked for a wake up call at 8! It was terrible! I’ll never recommend this place!!!

Summary Heading: Room is clean and parking lots  location is alwsome. Hotel...
Summary: Room is clean and parking lots  location is alwsome. Hotel location is perfect for travel around tourist attractions.

Summary Heading: Great Room, area is a little iffy, but security on premises made me feel safe
Summary: I was thrilled with everything in the room.  Very clean, nice fridge and microwave.  Beds were very comfortable.  I moved the furniture around, since the ac was only cooling the bottom of the table, and staff did not move things back every day - thank you, as I was there for 7 days.  Staff I ran into was great! I do hope the soap that was replaced every day was collected for shelters or such.  And shower head was a bit low, but then I am very tall too.  Only slight downside is the area.  But after dark, I saw what looked to be a security guard, so that gave me a level of comfort.  Oh yeah, and the room had an alarm clock with outlets to plug in my phone and computer - super bonus points for this!!!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: There were handprints on the wall and I don't why but you would think housekeeping would notice and clean it. Beds were decent. Staff was friendly.

While the staff was helpful the room was extremely tiny. MUCH too small for the two queen bed plus a large table and chairs that was crammed in front of the window and blocked the air conditioner. The table was shoved over by the second bedroom near the bathroom door so the air conditioner could be used. The jacuzzi didn't work in the much too tiny bathtub,  Internet was ok. There was a broken shade onot one of the lamps over the beds. Room was clean. No complaints there.
Clean Rooms, convenient parking and good breakfast. Convenient to a couple decent restaurants and Knotts Berry farm.

Booked this for last minute stay & surprisingly it was more than comfortable. Clean room, nice bed, good space, fresh bathroom and ample breakfast, parking. Room exterior & lights could be better. Overall nice for stay.

Room was clean and updated. I was not concerned at all about getting in the sheets. Most places I refuse to use the motel linens. And I always bring my own sanitizing and disinfecting products. I didn't have to use it here. It was so clean. And I felt even better that we came while housekeeping was cleaning because they cleaned the rooms so well! If you haven't noticed I'm a clean freak. Other than that wifi worked great. It was a quiet stay and just an overall comfortable room. Would definitely stay here again!
Good Service, Rooms need updating.  Breakfast area too small for the # of people. Nice Staff. Couldn't reliably stay connected on wifi.
Most comfortable bed and pillows used in a long time. Large rooms that were very well maintained and pleasant. Worth the price will be returning

Cheap, clean, comfortable. Great rooms with fridge and microwave, coffee machine etc. Fantastic maid service and plenty of fresh towels daily. Near to all amenities. Breakfast was completely crowded out but it was no big deal - Denny's is not far and does some great all you can eat pancakes for $4! Would definitely use again if in the area.

Summary Heading: Very average and no where near Disneyland.
Summary: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel for 2 nights, gees I wish we didn't stay here. Prior to coming to this hotel, a hotel staff member told me that they had a complimentary shuttle bus, however, upon arrivel the hotel check in told us that they didn't, so I was liad to by the hotel. The Hotel is at least a good 15 to 20 minute drive to Disneyland, so unless you are driving or hiring a car to drive, I would advise you to stay somewhere closer to Disneyland. The area surrounding the hotel has quiet a few homeless, how do we know, we walked to try and get some lunch on the first day we got to the hotel and there were several of them hanging around, so if you love staying in a dodgy area, then this hotel is perfect for you. The hotel staff I found to be fairly unhelpful when

I was impressed with the inside.  It was clean.  But the bathroom had ants running all over the floor.  I realized it was not worth the $115 a night.  Also the front desk area no one knew the correct policy regarding hotels.com and Days Inn reservations.

We were called at 2:38 am by a ypung female employee to come sign our check in papers.   I was livid, she was scared, dping what her mgr told her to do.  She was also still there that dame day after 6pm working.  Isnt there laws about this stuff?  16hr work days???
Its an old building. The rooms are small and ok. The outside of room is NOT clean. There's ample parking space.

Bathtub had jets for a Jacuzzi tub but didn't work. Jacuzzi jets were filthy and looked covered in black mild. Friends found cockroaches in their room which had a broken bathroom light and shower knob. Tv  commands were in Spanish and we couldn't change them because none of us can read Spanish which also made it difficult to fix when the input would change every time you tried to change the channel. The tv remote was also broken and would work about 25% of the time, even after changing the batteries. The breakfast was very basic and the eating area very small. The best thing about this place other then location was the beds.
Manager Response: Thank you for your very valuable feedback. I would like to first apologize for all the items you have brought up. We have a pest control company that services the hotel every month, and we will bring this review to their attention. In addition, our front desk are always happy to help with your needs, and I'm sorry they were unable to assist you with those issues.   Were you able to try out our hot waffles for breakfast? They are usually a hit with for our customers. But in any case, I'm sorry that they did not meet your expectations. Hopefully you can give us another chance in your next Disney trip.

Summary Heading: Disney Anaheim Days Inn Near the Park
Summary: Too far from Disney to walk, no shuttle that anyone mentioned, the drive to Disney was easy though. Hotel itself was decent, room was big enough and clean, beds were good (not great), pool and hot tub were nice but too close to the road.  Continental breakfast was too crowded, all sugar, didn't eat it.

Absolutely enjoyed our stay 💯. From check in to check out the staff was very helpful with directions questions n even parking questions around town. Very clean rooms with an awesome complimentary breakfast. Thanks I'll be back again very soon .

Summary Heading: Should not have days inn name on this hotel
Summary: Totally disappointed, ice machine was broke, fridge in room was iced over, room had black hairs all over. I had to ask for wash cloths everyday they kept giving me hand towels no wash cloths even when I had to go down to get them they kept giving me hand towels. They kept turning off the air in the room and it was hot when going back into it.  The rail to the hot tub was broke. I changed my leave day July 4,6,10 and had to explain it again on the 14 when they said I was checking out a day early!!! How many times do you need to be told!!

Summary Heading: No close at all and really
Summary: The really through was no clean at all was so dusty and the restroom has mold inside of the toilet the towels was so rug

Check in was quick and easy. Most of the staff were not very personable and one in particular was sarcastic and rude. The room was nice and clean, however five out of the six nights we stayed there we had to go to the office to request something that the maids forgot to leave in the room such as wash clothes, towels, coffee, etc.  One of the days I went to the office to get some coffee and they didn't have any regular coffee, just decaf.  They have a free shuttle to Disneyland, but it only runs from 0730 to 1030, then one trip at 1730, then it starts again at 2030 and runs until half hour after Disneyland closes according to the information they provided. However, we waited at Disneyland for quite some time during the time that the shuttle was supposed to be running and it never

Summary Heading: I will never stay here again
Summary: When I arrived, everything was fine and check in was easy enough. When we got into the hotel room, everything appeared fine. It wasn't until we started getting comfortable that I noticed that was black ants all over the counter where we had just put all of my stuff! When I called the front office, I was told they couldn't do anything about it that night. I let them know that that wasn't good enough...that they needed to at least come spray the room... Which they did.  Well that didn't really help because I got bit all night long and have huge bites all over!!!! I still have yet to hear from the manager. There was a nice gentleman the next morning that was able to give me a 50% discount because I was thoroughly upset. I will never ever stay here again. We walked across the street

Not a bad hotel. We stayed two nights, and it was comfortable and clean.  It's a short drive to Disneyland and very close to Knott's Berry Farm. Late night check-in was slow and done at an outside window which wasn't terribly convenient. We would stay here again though.

Not too expensive,budget friendly. Nice rooms for the price. Quiet, clean, modern, comfortable, great customer service, lots of amenities. Walking distance from a number of restaurants, stores, Disneyland andmuch more.

Spent a couple of nights here. The room was big and well set out. Close to theme parks. Food outlets within a ten minute walk.  Limited seating in the breakfast area. The first morning staff were everywhere the second morning they were nowhere to be found and most things had run out .

Found this place by driving past looking for somewhere to stay that I could also park the 32 foot RV in the carpark. Looked up on their website and found vacancies so walked in to Reception office and asked for a room. Was told they have no vacancies and when I said they still had rooms up online they said they weren't able to book those as they were held for online bookings only.  So I went back to my car and booked online then walked back into Reception to check in!  Don't these places have channel managers for their room inventory?  A lot of room sales are being lost because of this nonsense!  How many others were turned away that day by the Reception staff when rooms were available?  Sheer stupidity!  Anyway, once in the room  it was old and dated. Shower not clean with

Summary Heading: Booked on accident, on arrival realized we had stayed here...
Summary: Booked on accident, on arrival realized we had stayed here before. Both times ran into cockroaches. Need to get under control!

We asked for a room on the 3rd = top floor. We got a room at the 2nd, which was not mentioned during check-in and which we discovered when entering the elevator. Sound insulation is not very good; sounds from the neighbors are well heard.  The room itself was nice, good beds and a good bath room.  Free breakfast is a pro,although the waffle machine was missing (defect).

Summary Heading: we waited an hour to be able to use the waffle machine...
Summary: we waited an hour to be able to use the waffle machine because everyone was using it. I recommend to atleast get another

I slept in the room at the first floor and it was the most no-sound-proof room ever. Every sound from the outside was collected into the room and steps of guests from the upper room could be tracked by their sounds. I do not recommend this hotel to whom is sensitive at sounds during sleeping time.   Mattress was bit soft to me also. Breakfast menu was very plain, so do not expect anything else except some breads, juice and coffee.

Summary Heading: REALLY REALLY NICE AFTER HAD A TERRIBLE EXPERINCE ON MOTEL 6 ANAHEIM
Summary: After had a terrible experience on Motel 6 Anaheim one night before because the Motel 6 Anaheim was very , very dirty we just Cross the street and found Days Inn Hotel we went   from the heal to heaven, we had a wonderful experience and we paid just  the half of the price. I recommend  this hotel very  much

This is my second and last time staying at a Wyndham Hotel.  First of all, the toilet was clogged. I called the desk. The guy comes to the door and hands my daughter a plunger. I informed him, that's not my job. He then comes in mumbles something and says it's fixed.The next day, I had to call again because it overflowed again. The first night, we were awakened at 3 in the morning by someone trying to open our door.  They had assigned another guest our room.  Breakfast was cereal and milk.

the guy with the long curly hair at the front desk was very helpful, he knew the area well and let me know about the best beaches & places to take my kids & let me know where the closest gas stations and grocery stores are that helps out a lot  . I'm glad I checked in early because this parking lot gets packed at night

Summary Heading: If I knew it was part of the Wyndham chain, I would of never registered there!
Summary: Had bugs, lizard, bad air conditioning, and someone lied and said there name was Dave and told me the hotel was a helluva closer to my conference than it was . Boo!! Got a measly 10% my bill for my troubles and the manager is a ghost because I never saw the man. If I say anymore, my blood pressure will rise to one helluva of a unacceptable level.....

There was a party on the Saturday we were there and there was no parking available for people who actually booked to stay there. We had to park on a curb and when asked the front desk he didn't even know if that was okay. He just said as long as it was not blocking anyone. He seemed clueless. Overall the stay was good and very friendly staff at the front desk during the day.

i stayed here last year but my stay was ruined with remodeling of the rooms next to us.  Gave it a try again and the room was nicer and did not run into any problems other than the creaking from the room above was rather loud at night to a point it sounded like someone was walking in our room.  But over all was good, front desk staff was nice.

Summary Heading: I stayed in Days Inn hotel from April 26-April 30th 2017, with my son's family and my husband
Summary: First the location is about .7 mile from Disneyland. It's walkable. My husband and I stayed in two rooms, first a king bed, then had to move to a queen room, as we had two different reservations. My son stayed in a second, 2 bed queen size room. One night was paid for with CC, the second was paid for CC plus 40,000 points(RCI) along with $333.00 each room.We had moved into King bed room, then had to move out, even though, when I called hotel, they said they would try to accommodate us to stay in that room the entire time. Instead we had to move everything into our son's room, then after coming back from Disneyland move to second room-2 queen beds.It seemed the rooms were not built well, as we and my son had elephants in the rooms above us, that tromped around all night long. I

I wouldn't ever stay here again. Beds had hair on them. Elevators dirty. Breakfast was nasty. You could hear everything outside.  And most of all one of the workers put their hands on my daughter. And yes I reported this. I was highly upset....

Our stay at Days Inn was excellent. We were in town for WonderCon, and even though we could have stayed closer to Disneyland and the convention center, Days Inn was a great stay.   The staff was excellent and incredibly courteous. I was impressed by the continental breakfast that they offered. Most hotels offer a mediocre pastry, but Days Inn had a wide range of fresh fruit, waffles, fresh pastries, cereal, and good coffee and orange juice.   The beds were surprisingly comfortable, and the bedding and pillows were soft and fluffy. Something I don't usually expect from a cheaper hotel.  We used uber back and forth each day to Disney and the convention center, which ran is about $20 a day.   There are several fast food establishments nearby, but we used Grubhub as well for

Summary Heading: No water, cockroaches, filthy hot tub
Summary: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, but since I booked with Priceline, I couldn't get a refund. First the hotel is 6 miles or 20 minutes away from Disney. Second the continental breakfast is cold cereal or waffles. No eggs, no bacon, no yogurt, no fruit, just a poor selection. Third, our room had no water two of the three days that we were there. To top it off the hot tub looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a really long time.  The room smelled horrible, the a.c. hardly wprked, the office couldn't give me change to use the onsite laundry unless I bought something from their "mart", and don't park a big or new car in the lot because you won't fit without getting door dings. Did I mention the free WiFi that doesn't work?

I had 2 rooms 1 which was upgraded & the other u couldn't walk in. I had 2 cut my trip a day short due to a family emergency no refund on either room. Horrible customer service tell u 1 thing & do another

Summary Heading: Good place to sleep,get what you pay for
Summary: The place is near all Anaheim attractions and near Disneyland, it was a 9$ UBER ride to the Disneyland Parks which was good, it was clean, beds made well, shower, refrigerator, breakfast was simple but good , cofee, sweet buns, cereal and waffles, peanut butter jelly sandwiches for the kids. Very nice hotel staff, there was a young boy at the night desk and he is very helpful.
If you depend on a strong internet connection look elsewhere.  Staff friendly, attentive and made the stay pleasant.
Great value for the money, 5 minute drive to Disneyland, only complaint was stiff beds, wife loved it but I did not. Staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was simple but filling.
I will make this quick the hotel was nice and clean and the breakfast was good. I would stay again.

Rooms were OK but the bathroom was terrible dirty with roaches!!!!! Stuff was stolen from my room!!!!! Customer Service was terrible and the staff was very rude!!!! It was my daughters birthday trip and first time to Disneyland and it was ruined by the terrible events happening at this hotel!!!!

This was not our best experience.  Pros: - Room was nice, no issues here  - Continental breakfast included - not extensive but it was all we needed  - Staff were friendly and helpful in dire circumstances   Cons: - Very limited wifi which was difficult as we were international travellers that needed it to get around (eg order Uber's). - Location - said it was close to Disneyland when it definitely wasn't, we were told by multiple locals after we arrived that we were staying in a bad area known as the "ghetto" and we shouldn't go outside our rooms at night. - Could not walk around the area without feeling on edge and being very cautious.  - We were locked out of our room on the second night as the door swipe was broken and the reception man had to break in through the window so

Bedroom ok, needs updating.  Not sure of the safety of the neighborhood.  Took a copy of my drivers license " so they could monitor who was coming onto the property"  BUT what about all of those that were staying with the person who booked the room??!!!
The heater was not working, and the toilet was backed up.  I informed them at the front desk however they did not fix this problem so I checked out.

Summary Heading: Stayed at Ramada to attend the Living Stream Ministry 2015 and 2016 Winter Training.
Summary: It's nice to stay with all the saints from Bay Area and different countries, reasonable price including breakfast, 10-15 minutes drive to Living Stream Training center, Knott's Berry farm, and Disney Land.

My family and I stayed here for New Years, no family wants to spend New Years in a hotel but this place was comfortable and quiet for the most part. The staff was friendly. It was decently priced and the breakfast was okay. It was a great experience to stay here after Disneyland and CA Adventure. Will stay here again..
Arrived late but was greeted and taken care of fast. After checking we received a call to ask if our room was to our satisfaction. I will definately be back.

Amanda was great, as my first room was not ready and she got me a better room.  An hour later, she called the room to make sure everything was to my satisfaction.  Stay here anytime you're are in the area!

My granddaughter gold earring was stolen. I was getting ready to take a shower and the house keeper just walking in my hotel room with out knocking. I did not have any clothes on. There was a couple that was fighting and yelling at each other. They gave me the wrong room and wanted me to pay 10$ extra for a up grade.
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback. I see that you communicated multiple issues, all of which are very justified and important. For what's it worth, I would like to add that these experiences are definitely not normal. We train our housekeepers to always knock before coming to the room, and it's a practice that has been consistent for our 20 years of operations. However, I am very sorry to hear that the housekeeper barged in on you.   I also see that you did not get the wrong room. Upon checking the room you booked, you actually stayed at our expensive room. And for the gold earring, I checked our lost and found log and looked at the front desk log book, and nothing has been noted. These two are very critical issues that I would like to investigate. If you could reach out to me at tony@ramadaanaheimwest.com, I would like to connect and get more information about these two cases. Perhaps this is something we can resolve. In any case, I'm very sorry that you experienced these issues!

Summary: I arrived at a very deep night. But they greeted me. Room was very clean and good as expected. I want to visit again. Breakfast was also very good without worrying. It was a simple meal, but I was very happy. My family and friends also told me that my choice was great.

Stay was ok.  Lots and lots of noise from the upstairs room.  If the hotel is a building where the walls and floors are thin, Guests should be strategically placed to avoid placing guests in rooms one on top of the other, or directly next to each other -- if it can be avoided.  That way, you decrease the risks of guests experiencing loud noise that may distrupt their peace, thus affecting their overall experience at the Ramada
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I apologize that your stay was not as comfortable as you have wished due to the noise. You are absolutely right in that if possible, guests should not be placed too close to each other so that the noise reduction is ensured. Unfortunately, this is harder when our hotel gets booked up, but I really apologize for the noise that you experienced.   Our staff is always willing to help accommodate in these situations and try their best to make it better or make it right for you. But again, in this case, I understand the concern and I do apologize.

Summary: Nice hotel, beds were ok, dated looking, Nice breakfast. Overall not a bad place to stay. Were there 5 nights, no complaints.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I'm glad to see that your trip was nice. Hopefully you had the chance to try our hot waffles as part of our free complimentary breakfast. I understand that the hotel did look dated looking, but we are working on it :) Thanks for choosing to stay with us!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Overall the hotel wasn't so bad. Stayed for two nights, our room was cleaned right after the first night except the cleaning lady probably forgot to replace the towels she took. Had to call the front desk the next morning for new ones. The room has a fridge, microwave, AC, TV and a blow dryer. Appliances were a little outdated, but we were out for most of our trip anyways. Like I said- you get what you paid for.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Krystal. I'm glad to see that recognized the appliances in our rooms. You are correct - we have a mini-fridge, microwave, blow dyer, as well as an ironing for each room. I do understand that you found the hotel to be a bit dated, but I would like to add that we are going through renovations, and things will look and feel a lot newer soon. Cheers!

Summary: Staff was friendly, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Exactly what I was looking for in a quick overnight stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback. It's great to hear that you had an overall good experience. I would like to add that we are going through some renovations - replacing carpets, draperies, wallpaper! Hope you see you again soon.

Summary: had a nice room after the first room was not ready Henry did a great job getting us the new room and it was bigger than the other also had a little problem with our reservation when we added another day on but Todd made it all work out for us so thanks guys for a job well done

Summary Heading: We only stayed for one night. Check in was very fast, and...
Summary: We only stayed for one night. Check in was very fast, and the tall gentleman at the front desk was very nice. I loved the bed, didn't wake up with a sore back like at other hotels. The breakfast was waffles, cereal, pastries no other hot foods like other hotels offer. The lady there was very helpful. So for what we paid and having breakfast included it was a deal for me......It was my three teen daughters and myself.

Clean room with good parking.  Worth the money to stay there. Good assortment for the continental breakfast.  3 issues that would not keep me from staying there again; Clerk not very friendly when we checked in, but was quick  Walls very thin so you can hear everything going on in adjoining rooms and above Breakfast area way too small for the amount of people staying there
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking your time to leave us a comment. We value all guest feedback. Concerning the issue you had with our clerk, we feel badly that you were not welcomed as friendly as you would've liked. We make sure that all of our clerks read the guest reviews so that your concerns will be communicated. As for the breakfast area being too small, unfortunately our hot waffle breakfast is popular with a lot of guests. We are going to do our hardest to make sure we can meet the demands of our customers. Thank you again for your input.   -Tony

Summary Heading: Spacious room size. Very nicely decorated.
Summary: I just barley returned from this hotel for a two night stay. Had a great time. The exterior of this hotel was the greatest, but the minute I walked in my room I was amazed. Time warner cable and flat screen tv. Comfortable beds and the vibe was very relaxed. Definitely worth the stay!

We arrived early before check in to see if we could get into our room to change clothes for a funeral. The room was not ready yet but the staff was very helpful and let us change in the lobby restroom so we made the funeral on time. When we arrived back at the hotel after the funeral, they were very nice and the room was ready. We went to the hot tub to relax and only half the jets worked and it was right next to Beach Boulevard so the traffic was very load. Not very relaxing. The bed though was very comfortable and the waffles the next day were delicious.

Our room was a handicap accessible room with no bath tub. It was such a pain. Moreover the bathroom was not so good in quality. Next problem was that the room was just next to ice vending machine. We could hardly get any sleep for 2 days.  The other room that we could thought we can shift was also next to an ice vending machine. Moreover the room had very sharp smell of some kind of paint or chemicals may be used for cleaning.  It was not an good experience overall with Ramada. We expected to have a much better stay.
I felt that ;seeing we were there from Thursday ,that the price should have remained the same ,instead of increasing,every additional day.

Myself and two friends stayed here last week. It was a very humble room, but it filled all our needs.  25 minute drive from Huntington Beach,  12 minutes to Disney, 5 to Knotts. Great location! Continental breakfast, hottub and pool were all great as well! I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel was great had some rowdy neighbors above us that would jump on the floor all night but that's expected at a hotel. The only disappointment was the breakfast the food wasn't the problem it was the layout so unorganized no room to move there was no way to get a line formed because it was so tight in there waited 10 min to get a muffin and a banana with all the people cutting in front of the line other wise was a great stay !
it was ok for the most part.  my daughters did not like the way the pool or spa looked so they did not try it.

Hotel was clean and convenient to all parks!  10 minute drive to Disney, 5 minute drive to Knotts, and about 15-20 minutes to the beach! The staff never refilled our coffee fixings for our room. The breakfast is a carb fest. They need real creamer, some boiled eggs, and yogurts. Pool was clean and not crowded. Family friendly. Beds were comfortable but unfortunately our upstairs neighbors were very noisy.  Good hotel for price. Do not park in the covered check in area. Cars fly into the parking lot.

Good for the price.  It was a clean, quiet family hotel. The beds were comfortable. It had everything advertised. The hot tub was nice and hot.   The problems were the the internet was spotty and signed me out if I was idle for even a couple of minutes. The breakfast was mostly cheap bread products and watered down juice. The lobby door is locked at night so I had to check stand outside and check in through a small slot in the window.

Summary Heading: No shower enclosure. The whole bathroom floor becomes wet...
Summary: No shower enclosure. The whole bathroom floor becomes wet. It was worse than even a motel. Did not expect that from Ramada. The breakfast was just ok. We stayed just one night.

The room and accommodations were uneventful but everything worked and was clean.  The only issue we had was that our room key had to be redone just about every time we left the room and the internet was not all that strong.   Clean and quiet area.

Summary Heading: great value.  close to theme parks, but filthy rugs.
Summary: It's a good place to stay.  A lot of parking.  The room is big.  The beds are comfy. It has a coffee maker, mini fridge and microwave.  The towels need to replaced to thicker newer ones.  The conTinental breakfast is nice.  This hotel got a 3 rating because of the really filthy rugs.  Change it to laminate flooring please! Also the elevator sensor doesn't  work properly. The door will close on you really fast without  notice. The internet was lousy.

We have been coming to this hotel for over 4 years now, and we always have a great stay. The rooms are nice and spacious and the beds are super comfy. It's great that continental breakfast is included, the waffles are a big hit with the kids. Todd and all the staff made our stay a great stay. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Will be back again next year.

Summary Heading: Very good value hotel in the Disney parks vicinity
Summary: Excellent value for money, clean room, decent breakfast. We stayed here to visit Disney Adventure Park California as other hotels closer by are very, VERY expensive. The staff were friendly and the neighborhood was fine.
Family Disneyland trip - a few miles away, so it was a better deal. The check in was done outside and we had to request towels several times.

Summary Heading: My family and I wanted to do disneyland for 3 days did not...
Summary: My family and I wanted to do disneyland for 3 days did not have any issues at this place except its about a 10-15 min drive to where we wanted to go but, it was ok. breakfast was good. got the room online I also read reviews on this room and looked at pictures and thought to go somewhere else. glad I didn't it was a bit different when I went there in person. I do recommend to be up stairs cause theres lots of noise down stairs from people coming back or just now checking in.

2 families with same last name checking in, for a reservation booked by one in the party, wishing to pay on separate credit cards.  This took a long time either the agent was new or inexperienced.  Rooms were clean enough and we spent very little time in them. Did not use pool or any other
Nice place to just lay tourneys while visiting. Basic breakfast rooms were basic but comfortable

Summary Heading: did a nice job replenishing towels and making the bed. however at night you will be woken up in the middle of the night
Summary: Reservations was cancelled even though I showed up. People above us kept walking around waking us up at 2am. Breakfast wasn't anything special.

This is an older facility, likely built in the late 1960s, but it is well maintained. Everything worked as it should, the systems were well-maintained, house-keeping was exemplary, and the staff was cordial. It would be nice to have a broader breakfast selection, but this facility predates the era of nearly mandatory continental breakfast. Access was better-than-adequate from either direction on Beach Boulevard.

Summary Heading: Loud neighbors, busy road, 25$ cab ride to Disneyland, cold dirty pool
Summary: This hotel was very crowded over spring break and we could hear people in their rooms above and below and beside us at all hours.  It is NOT close to Disneyland, we paid anywhere from $22-$30 to get cabs EACH way to/from Disneyland.  The breakfast was fine, about 8 tables, so OK.  There are a few restaurants nearby to get reasonable food.  The beds were good, the hide-a-bed was a disgrace - we took the mattress off and put it straight on the floor for better comfort. On the frame it sagged.  The pool AND the hot tub were very cold - not even worth going in to.  We had booked this hotel for 6 days, and we moved to another hotel after 3 days.  Wifi was free, but very hard to access (too busy likely). You can do better.

Summary Heading: Not what I would expect from a Ramada
Summary: You get what you pay for. The price was good and it is right between Disneyland and Knotts, so the location was perfect for us.  I was disappointed with the look of the property and the room.  More like a Super 8 or Motel 6 than a Ramada.  Service was polite and fine.  Spa was not working, breakfast forgettable.  Had problems with the internet, but did not report it.  We spent very little time in the room, so as the price & location were good for our purposes, we did not complain.

Summary Heading: Quite possibly the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in!
Summary: The room was terrible! Carpet tearing up, drawers screwed shut, "pull out bed" nothing but a pleather futon that was so uncomfortable that we had to pay for another room for the night just to get a real bed. The breakfast was TERRIBLE! They had 1 employee making waffles one.at.a.time. DON'T STAY HERE!

Actually I would rate my visit as above average. Staff(ALL STAFF managers down to maintenance guy)) on all 4 days were very courteous, polite and treated my baby girl like the little Queen she thinks she is. Great value for the Easter weekend I was there. Room was comfortable and CLEAN, as well the property in itself.

You know, I think a lot of people are getting the wrong idea when coming to the place. I was able to book a two night stay for $66.00 dollars a night. I see a lot of people writing reviews about little things here or there, but to be honest, this isn't a five star hotel.  For $66.00 an evening, we had access to our nice, clean rooms, access to the pool and hot tub, free breakfast, and only about a 6 mile drive out to Disneyland. Overall, our experience was great and there was nothing to complain about.  Plenty of bang for your buck, and as long as you are reasonably setting an expectation of what you are paying vs. what you are getting, I would say this offers a great consumer value.

Summary Heading: Ten minute easy drive from Disney
Summary: The hotel appeared to be in a good location and a ten minute easy drive from Disney.  There were several restaurants and supermarkets within a short drive.  The room was small but clean and quiet; there is a small pool which we didn’t use.  The staff where pleasant and very helpful, breakfast included toast, coffee, fruit and pastries and was served until 10am.

We were only really in our room to sleep and shower. The room was clean. We did make use of the hot tub and pool that were available. The pool and hot tub were both nice and clean. We were unable to utilize the free breakfast offered because there were so many people ahead of us that everything was gone. It was fine for what we needed, if we were going to stay for a longer period of time, I would stay in a different motel though. The parking is really tight and our car received some huge scratches from another car in the parking lot due to the lack of parking space available. Also the bathtub faucet did not turn off while using the shower, so there was standing water in the tub while showering.

While I was disappointed at check-in that my request for adjoining rooms had not been honored, I was relieved when the daytime desk attendant moved one of my rooms so they could be next to each other. It would have been nice of one of the bathtubs could hold water for a bath.

Summary Heading: Good service but WRONG WEBSITE INFO
Summary: The check-in was fine, desk attendant was polite and got the keys and everything quickly without delay, but INACCURACIES ON THE WEBSITE, specifically the "fitness center/gym". Apparently it has been under "repair" for a while and I picked this specific hotel (despite it being a good distance from where I wanted to be) mostly because they had a fitness center. UPDATE YOUR WEBSITE INFO!!
Helpful staff...clean rooms, very accommodating to our large group. Excellent value. Spacious rooms. Great towels.  Plenty of parking. Great breakfast. Felt comfortable and safe.

The hotel was not great but decent. The staff was efficient.  They should walk the grounds on all levels it was obvious someone was smoking marijuana every night.  There were a lot of children there and the smell was very strong.

I only really give 1 star when the stay is really bad and this was that bad.  There are gaps and holes so that bugs can enter the rooms.  I found out that bugs came through the vent in the bathroom as well as the gaps from the front door.  The toilet flush so fast that even a snail will have time to crawl out.  Even my neighbor had the same issues and we both had to plunge our own toilets.  Yes, we did it.  Horrible stay.  Pay a bit more and stay elsewhere.

We stayed here for 3 nights of our Disneyland trip. It is not too far away from Disneyland. Sure, it's not a newer, or fancy place to stay, but that was not what we were looking for. It was CLEAN (first priority) and there was breakfast. The breakfast options consisted of waffles, bagels, fruit, cereals options, oatmeal, coffee, juice and I think there was also yogurt... so if you are not ok with those options, Im sure you'll find another breakfast choice not too far away. The area is probably not the best, but we had no problems. The staff was kind and helpful. If you don't mind an older place, this is for you. Oh yeah.... the wifi is pretty slow, so if that is a determining factor... there you go..of course this can always change.

We made a reservation 3 weeks ahead of time for 2 queen beds, only to arrive and the four of us were given a single king room.  Lots of disrespect from the person greeting us, who after telling us there were no other rooms also yelled at us for touching anything in the room in case he was going to transfer us to another room.  We asked for 2 rollaways for the kids, and was told that we had to pay $10 per night per bed. I said, "I don't think I should have to pay anything, since our reservation was for 2 queen beds."  He responded, "Well, are you going to pay my labor?  I don't get paid practically anything at all here, you have to pay my labor costs."  Truly a lack of customer service.  I spoke with the manager on check out and she agreed they had gotten a number of complaints

I booked a last-minute trip to Anaheim over Thanksgiving for my sons hockey tourney.   Didn't want to spend alot and found this hotel.  If you can look past the not so great neighborhood, this is a very nice place.  While it may be an older hotel, it is very clean and we'll managed.  The front desk was very friendly, the maids take great pride in their jobs judging by the cleanliness of the entire property.  The breakfast area was very clean and the food was ample.  Only complaint was that the was were very thin and I was on the road side.  The road noise was very loud, glad I brought my Nose headphones.  So if noise bothers perhaps ask for a room at the back of the property.

Summary Heading: The room was clean. The staff were friendly & professional...
Summary: The room was clean. The staff were friendly & professional.  The free breakfast was great, fruit, cereal, bagels, toast, sweet rolls, waffles, oatmeal, coffee and  juice

Another hotel nearby, whom we had reservations with, kept us waiting and then couldn't run our payment... we were almost up a creek without a paddle, when the Ramada Inn saved the day! They took the payment no problem, gave us a nice, clean room with a HUGE tub!

Summary Heading: Decent, clean hotel with free breakfast
Summary: We chose this hotel for both its close proximity to Disneyland and affordable price.   PROS: Clean, affordable, close to Disneyland. The room had a flatscreen TV. The free breakfast was my favorite part. There were muffins, toast, oatmeal, pastries, coffee, juice, and they also had batter for making your own waffles.
