CONS: If you're looking for atmosphere, this isn't the place. The room was really stuffy when we first arrived, and the AC shut off immediately when we turned it on so we had to keep the window open. AC worked fine on the second night and it was much better.

I was pleased with our room. It was clean and quiet. There was an odor when we first walked in, but it dissipated quickly after we turned on the a/c. The a/c was adequate during our stay, but I don't think it would be on a hot summer day. The internet would never connect. The staff were cordial.

Summary Heading: There's a dead cockroach in our room.
Summary: Front desk staff tried to accommodate guests, however, I think, this hotel needs a whole make over. Big time! Pest control for starters! My kids were screaming because the a dead "bug" on the floor inside our room. Lo and behold, there's a huge dead cockroach on the floor, it's about a little more than one inch! One inch! Whoah, that is huge. When we came, the room, smells old. Okay fine, I'm not expecting much because of how much we paid. There's an old A/C without a thermostat. Still okay. Bathroom floor is ridiculously dirty! Dirty is unacceptable. We just have to suck it up. Just do not step on anything barefoot because you don't know what you are going to get. Old is acceptable because what we paid. But dirty, topped with a dead cockroach?! Is totally unacceptable. We will
The room was okay for the price.  Breakfast left a lot to be desired.  The breakfast room was way too small and the food all needed the toaster, including the toaster style waffles.

Summary Heading: Great place, perfect location and a nice room.
Summary: This place is in the perfect location for a visit to Disney.  Within 20 mins you can walk right to the front entrance.  You can see the fireworks from the balcony at the back of the motel.  There is a pool, we didn't have time to use it though.  Breakfast is limited but there is plenty of it.  Having to wait for a staff member to make your waffles is a bit rubbish, I think it would be better to be able to make your own.  The microwaves shouldn't be by the door between the rooms, makes it impossible to get past.  It wasn't busy when we were there, I can imagine it being really hard to get anything when it's busy.  Room was clean enough, the TV was broken, would not turn off, we had to put up with it all the first night as the maintainance men had left when we called down to

Summary Heading: They claimed there's Internet access,  but I  was told by...
Summary: They claimed there's Internet access,  but I  was told by front desk that there's NO Internet to the rooms, and they have reported to the GM fir weeks but nothing has been dobe We were offered to do our Internet @the lobby.  I declined because I have plenty of work to do. This does not represent Ramada. The room rate is NOT worth it !!! They should not be a member of Wyndham.
Nice hotel that had a clean room, slightly dated but still nice. Staff was friendly and accomadating.

Summary Heading: Had good time at the hotel
Summary: I stayed along with my family in the hotel for 2 nights.  I booked 2 rooms. The rooms are clean.  Shower was great.  Was able to get additional towels.  Breakfast was nice.  Was able to make fresh waffles.  Internet instructions were not clear and was not able to connect to internet.  During check-in, my drivers license was not returned.  I thought I lost it on the trip.  When I called them back after my return, they told that they have.  It was a common courtesy to inform me about them having the card and return the card immediately.  Waiting for them to mail me my drivers license.

The title of the hotel says it all... LIMITED. Keep this in mind when reviewing or shopping for hotels. The area is not the best, However, it's safe. Anaheim police patrol Beach blvd day and night to assure this. Although, this part of Beach Blvd has a bad reputation, it's been cleaned u and toned down in recent years. As a local,  I live nearby with family and need to book a hotel if I desire privacy, or time with company. This location is close to me, and is usually a great price for the name Ramada. The amenities are limited, and the office staff is not very personable, however the housekeeping is great and sweet as can be! When taking all into to consideration I'm satisfied with my stay.

Summary Heading: Very reasonable price for the location. Will b lookin to...
Summary: Very reasonable price for the location. Will b lookin to stay a few nights again in October if the price is right. Thank u for your time and consideration
Over all great experience. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Great price, and excellent check-out time. Will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Roaches, Bed sinking in, Door broken, No pool privacy, Dirty walls, Customer Service
Summary: German Cockroaches came from sink. Bed sinking in, Door broken, Mildew smell, Blood on pillows. No pool privacy, 15 min to use waffle maker.

Summary Heading: Well what I am about to tell you is kind of sad because...
Summary: Well what I am about to tell you is kind of sad because before I made reservations to the hotel the gentleman name cris who was working at time I had ask him if he had a room available and his first response was no he was not to interest of checking if he had a room or not so I decided to check online n there was rooms available so book it n I enjoy my stayed we stayed 18and19 n check out on the 20

We were tickled to see the room with the bidet and the x-large hand-crafted tub. The style is definitely not new, but it had a charm that we liked. It was clean and the bed was comfortable.   We had a hard time finding free sockets for our phones and laptops, and for some reason the maid did not clean our room, though that might have been because we had the "Do not Disturb" sign up until about noon. We did not ask because we did not get in until after midnight, so we are not sure.  The waffles in the morning are great, but be sure to stand in line. We stayed off to the side and we almost got skipped over because we did not realize there was a line. The house keeping lady told us we had to go stand in line, but since we were there first we got to get in the front of the line.

Summary Heading: No tub or shower help useless
Summary: No working tub or shower was told that they could not do anything about it and that a manager would be in at 9:00 am next morning I waited till after 9:00 to check out still no manager and told again that they could not do anything to compensate the inconvenience told me they documented the problem (which I doubt) needless to say we won't stay there again.

hotel was ok, checked out on the day i was supposed to , after i got home and checked my credit card statement they charged me for 1 extra day!!! when i contacted the front desk they told me it was because i checked out before 8 am, then they told me they didnt know y i was charged extra and will call me back. while i was asking for directions they had overcharged someone else and was refunding them.. i  will never use wyndham again!!!

Our stay has averaged out to be fair. It has been clean. No shortage of towels. Pleasant personnel. There have been great stays with no added noise from neighbors and good working air conditioners/fans. But there have been equal amounts of rooms with poorly working ac units and dripping noises in the bathrooms as well as upstairs neighbors walking across the floor all night! Some things are out of control (noisy neighbors) but I would like to feel confident that going into the room everything works all the time. The food quality is not agreeable to my troubled tummy and there is a lack of proper protein but it is satisfactory for the rest of my family. The cost has risen $20 in one year and am disappointed that the nonworking amenities are not reflecting the cost increase but
The area was sketchy, the room was not in decent shape, & we were uncomfortable the entire time.

Summary Heading: Electrical sockets in the room we stayed are loose. Aircon...
Summary: Electrical sockets in the room we stayed are loose. Aircon in my car is colder than in the room we stayed. Shower heads are so low, they are not for people 6 foot up.

Decent hotel and decent price. A nice pool and jacuzzi, rooms just ok, clean and good beds. Basic breakfast, continental. A good choice to stay for Disneyland or another park from here, because is close from all parks.

The hotel was fine for an overnight stay. My only complaints are the reservation was for a Spa Tub room... didnt have one. And the toilet stopped flushing after a couple uses... we didnt call to complain because we were leaving the next morning anyway.

If you are planning to use internet during your stay during peak vacation season and this place is fully booked, you'd be better off finding a local coffee shop because honestly, if you had any optimism in you like I did, you will find the connection more than just infuriating. The choppy internet is most likely caused by the large amount of guests staying here at the same time as me, but the fact that every time you close and open a new browser, it requires you to log in again is beyond my understanding.  Aside from that, there were 3 guys at the front desk I encountered during the week I stayed here. All three have a way of deferring whatever questions or concerns you might have to the person that will be workin the shift after them. Be it a question you might have regarding

I found this hotel very cheap on internet. Clean and comfy room, very well located. Comlementary breakfast and nice outdoors pool. Profesional staff. I stayed for only one night after going to the Angels stadium, just 10 minutes away. Elevator.

Service was unnecessarily confrontational,  unintuitive,  and sterile that appeared to strive for mediocrity to match it's budget. I don't expect exceptional service for budget motels,  but smiles and a friendly attitude should be a given regardless of the star the hotel resembles.  Secondary to this is the cleanliness of the room; I've had this weird rash appear on my wrist,  under my neck and by my ankle that appeared promptly upon arriving.  The bathroom floors look like they haven't been washed for a few visits.  There was hair in the shower.  It's just below the level I'd expect of cleanliness for a budget hotel of this quality,  but usually the service mitigates the cleanliness and polyester-esque linens.  This time it was just beyond disappointing and I will not be

I stayed their in May! The rooms were very nice and clean! The breakfast was excellent! The Wifi did work fine. The female manager Patricia was amazing! She was helpful in everything and she works 7 days!

stayed here for 3 nights while we visited Disneyland. the location was ideal, only a 10 minute drive to Disney. but thankfully, we only used the room to sleep in, the wifi wasn't great and it was very noisy. but other than that it was fine for the price we paid.

I've stayed at a few Ramadas...this is by far the most disappointed one I've been in...the rooms wasn't bad, but staff morale leaves a lot to be desired....they were unhelpful and rude...every question was met with "I don't know".I mean what's the point of they working in a hotel if they can't answer basic questions.
Tile all mismatched in bathroom, carpet dirty, smelly room, beds were double not a queen as promised. Ants in bathroom.

Room is fine. Clean which is the most important. Beds are comfortable and it is quite. Special contribution to the fourth star that I gave is because a very friendly guys at the reception welcomed us. Thank you:)

I was disappointed in the property.  My room was nice but it sounded like water running the whole time.  The air conditioner did not have much fan power so the room did not get very cool.  Early in the morning they started to do construction on the room next to me and it was extremely noisy and actually woke me up.

Summary Heading: Great hotel respect to room fare and the amenities...
Summary: Great hotel respect to room fare and the amenities included, such as wireless internet, microwave and fridge in the room, excellent location close to the major thematic parks in Anaheim.
Enjoying a few days of family vacation, rest in this hotel with very good service and good price, comfortable rooms.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel - Close to Disneyland
Summary: Nice place Very close to Disneyland - 10 minutes drive Big and clean room Wifi was poor in the room. Worked good in the Dining hall. Free breakfast that can be improved by adding eggs but not bad. Nice and clean outside pool. Good staff. Quiet room, nice beds and AC worked very well.

We (two adults and two kids) travelled from Edmonton, Canada and stayed at this hotel for four nights. Pretty decent hotel, close to Disneyland and a few major attractions in town. Very big room, clean, AC worked very well and very capacious. Nice layout with sink outside the washroom that helped a lot especially when washroom is occupied. The outside pool is very nice, parking is too big and good. Breakfast can be improved with adding eggs to it but still it's a decent breakfast to start a day. Friendly staff and the place is quiet and nice.

Summary Heading: Good placed to stay for the room
Summary: Room small - ok, was taken care of daily, but property is showing signs of age which to some may not be attractive.  No complaints though.  Complimentary b-fast in the morning was nice.

Summary Heading: Not good - was supposed to say longer but ran away
Summary: As soon as the door opened the awful smell of the room hit me. This has lowered my opinion of the hotel chain. The room was a don't touch anything you don't have to uncleanliness

Please improve the free breakfast.  The pastries are disgusting, the fruit looked rotten and the milk was not cold.  The waffles were ok, but the machine that cooks them was not functioning the best.  Breakfast is a deal breaker for our family.  We book our rooms based on hotels with breakfast.  Please think about improving.

So we booked for two rooms side by side so we could open then conjoined doors for our kids to have their own room and for us to have our own room. The first day we get to Anaheim I get an email saying my card isn't processing and to call the hotel asap well they put in the wrong expectation date so there's that. Next day 3 charges on my card for the hotel besides the room cost. No room service provided so I called front desk. This is our last day we've been here a week and it's still not being charged right. Housekeeping comes when they feel like it can't time at all as well as being very rude to us while we did laundry on last day. Check in had to be after 2 pm and cable here sucks. Also a pain getting into hotel because of location no I turns in California. More then likely

The rooms were clean but cramped with the table and chairs. Table blocked the ac unit though it did still work to cool the room just less efficiently. Beds and pillows were comfy. Shower had good temp and pressure. Parking was atrocious.

We spend six nights here for a spring break Disneyland/Beach vacation.  We had the best experience.  No problems at all.  Nice big rooms...even with two queen beds they are big rooms.  It was clean and quiet and nicely located.  Straight shot to the beach and not far from Disneyland.  Wifi was great, the pool and hot tub were nice after leaving the snow and ice at home.  We will ABSOLUTELY stay here again.  Cleaning staff is great as well.  After reading other reviews we were a little nervous about what it would be like, but honestly we were thrilled with it.  Then we had to come back home to Abilene leaving California behind...how sad. :(  OH something else I said I wanted to mention in my review...the beds are PERFECT!!  So many motels have beds that are too hard, but these

For the price, we found a good value here with clean room, variety for free breakfast, fridge and microwave in rooms. Beds were not uncomfortable. Anything we asked was arranged. Don't expect this to be a 5 star hotel, but overall it was better than we expected. The staff was helpful and made the stay more enjoyable.

Old old hotel! Has not updated possibly ever. I read previous reviews which mention it was a great hotel so I chose to stay there based on reviews. I was not familiar with the area but did not feel safe or clean

Summary Heading: A car parked next to mine was being robbed in day light! I...
Summary: A car parked next to mine was being robbed in day light! I reported that to the staff in the front desk and they did nothing about it!!!! Very irresponsible and I was very concerned about my safety and the safety of my family. I had to check out and find another hotel to spend the night in.

Everything was clean and in its place. The only problem we ran into was there was water on the bathroom floor the following morning. We thought the water was coming from the tank but it was actually the wall. Everything else was great!! Love the the rooms have microwaves and refrigerators!!

Summary Heading: Met all of our expectations. Received the room type we...
Summary: Met all of our expectations. Received the room type we requested with the additional equipment on time as promised. Friendly, capable staff. We are regular users of this motel.

You get what you pay for. If you are noise sensitive like myself, request a room on the third floor. While on the second floor, you can hear every step from the floor above which is very irritating. Was moved to the third floor which helped with the noise a bit. The card key worked very poorly. With both rooms that I was in, you have slide it in at least 2-3 times before you can get in, sometimes required to slide in 4 times?! Just so frustrating. Sheets didn't appear all that clean either. Wifi signal on third floor was much too weak. The facility seemed a bit run down. Need serious renovation.
I like to thank you to honor my early check-in request. Room was nice and clean. We enjoy our stay and love to stay again.

My family and I have been to this Ramada for many years , first of all I usually don't complaint. but this is something that I never encounter for all the years of vacationing..1) No running water , 2) electronic key stop working. 3) my curtain was open .4) my door WAS NOT CLOSE. when I came back that evening, I went to the front desk ..they told me that there were no manager on duty on weekends?. I do not know what kind of operation you run here

Summary Heading: Bad Food. Bad Ventilation. Smelly room
Summary: Room was very smelly.. the AC was just a joke.. it was not at all effective in reducing the temperature. breakfast was a cruel joke

My friend and I were at Disneyland until closing.  We got to the Ramada Inn at 1 AM.  We were so tired and looking forward to a nice nights sleep.  I have stayed in Ramada Inn's before, but never  EVER quite like this.  My friend climbed into bed, pulled the covers up over her and jumped out screaming - EW, EW, EW!!!   Her blankets smelled like URINE!  Now being a mom of 4, there is not mistaking that smell.  So, we called down to the front desk and requested clean bedding for  both beds.  I didn't even get in my bed, I was to afraid.  The night clerk brought us the bedding and told us we had to change it ourselves, because there way no housekeeping in at that hour.  That's ok with us.  So, we took the bedding off and and there on the mattress, was a huge blood stain!!!  It was

I booked this hotel on booking.com because it was reasonably priced and not too far from Disneyland/the convention center. The pictures on booking looked relatively nice, and they were rated with 3 stars. The Ramada name was also a plus!  Upon arriving at the hotel, my friend and I checked in. It was about 11:00pm, and we were exhausted after a day at Disneyland. The hotel was clearly run down, but we were both eager to get some sleep so didn't really mind. After checking in, we went to grab our bags from the car to bring them to the room. As we were unloading our bags, an SUV rolled up behind my car, blocking it in. At first I didn't notice, but my friend stopped what she was doing to inform me that the two older men in the car were both looking at us and the driver was saying

Summary Heading: Terrible hotel, very poor customer service
Summary: This hotel is not trust worthy. We booked this hotel (and five other hotels) a month in advance for our trip to the US through booking.com. Everything went well with all other bookings, until the check-in day of this hotel. I received an email from booking informing us that the hotel could not charge our credit card to secure the booking and that if we did not get back to them by 6pm, the booking would be cancelled. I rang the hotel at 3pm and was told that it had been cancelled a few days ago!!! No correspondence was made to inform us about that. No explanation, no excuse at all. The attitude of the receptionist was unacceptable! I requested to talk to his manager, but was refused.  If you have ever booked a hotel near Disneyland Anaheim, you may know how busy they are during

This hotel offers "jacuzzi" rooms at a reasonable price.  And fairly nice and "close" to Disney/Knott's.  There's also some nice "collectibles" shops at the corner of the street if you that's your thing.  Though I was never informed how to access the free wifi.  This is something you think would be given to you at check-in, but it wasn't.
the tub was dirty and full of someone's hair that was never cleaned out. All over the wall and tub.

I like it...good value. Love breakfast ...the only thing I didn't like was the shower didn't had a separate floor or surface...it was only a drain on the middle of the bathroom and after taking a shower the whole room was how was flooded and the carpet  soak and wet all the times..

Room was clean w/ no bad odors.  Wifi almost non existant.  Hot tub stopped working after the first night, beds hard, shower to short.  Ac stopped working second night we were there, they moved us to a new room quickly.  Breakfast consisted of waffles, fruit, juice, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, and danishes.  Todd the desk clerk during the day was extremely helpful, friendly, and really tried to make our stay a good one.  He was one of the best parts of our stay.

The hotel itself seems a little outdated. Our room flooded the 1st night and ruined some belongings of ours. I was told a couple times that the manager was not in the area the entire 4 days we were down there. I filled out a damaged property report and requested for a manager to call me to discuss ASAP. It has now been 5 days and no one has contacted me at all. Customer service was poor as the staff on site could not help me with anything including getting in contact with their manager. Will not be staying here again.

After arriving to find a run down room, getting past the old stale moldy smell of the room, waking up to bug bites. I checked out a night early. Oh but the manager isn't available and I still got charged for the two nights. If I could give it 0 stars I would. Ramada should be ashamed to have its name on this piece of trash. And they have it listed as a 3 star hotel!! What a ripoff!!!

Rudest customer service EVER. Try getting in the lobby at 6;30 am. Good luck with that.  Either they are not there or they tell you to come back in 5 minutes.  Really? I have spent my last night there!

Summary Heading: Not luxurious but clean, relaxing and good free breakfast.
Summary: Room was big with two queen size bed, small bathroom but clean. Nice breakfast as it was free. Only problem is it's not very close to Disney land. Also it doesn't have any view which was not necessary as whole day and half of the night, we were in Disney land.

The worst hotel i've ever stayed in my life. We reserved the room for two days and made sure of it to staff when we checked in, so we left all the foodstuffs in refrigerator which is equipped in the room. But the second day when we got back, we found all of them were gone. I asked staff to give them back, but he told us that the housekeeper stole them. he apologized and guaranteed a repayment or discount and asked us to talk to manager next day. However the next day, manager didn't come and the staff we claimed last night wasn't there as well. No messages and compensation afterward. we really dissapointed and regret that we chose this hotel.

Summary Heading: This was a horrible area. If u like to b around hookers n...
Summary: This was a horrible area. If u like to b around hookers n druggie then this is the hotel for u. I was quoted 76.00 online n end up paying 88.00 which was bs. If I knew how bad the area n the hotel was I would have paid 20.00 more dollar to stay at the Fairfield inn. When i think of thr ramada inn, i think of a high end hotel. The room we got was out dated. The carpet was diry n sticky. The bed was hard n it smell. It was supposed to b a non smoking area but people where smoking like it was nothing. Will never return back here. Felt unsafe n keep looking out the window to see if my car was safe!

Room was clean and comfortable but clothing hook in bathroom was mounted flush with the top of the door, way too high to use. Water in spa was in need of treatment. Breakfast was average, the room was small though and very congested with other people trying to fix their meal and eat.

Summary Heading: Overall, I was satisfied with the two queen sized beds, but...
Summary: Overall, I was satisfied with the two queen sized beds, but the sleeper couch and the roll away bed were substandard in quality and need to be replaced, as they are uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: The biggest thing that I did not expect as I have stayed at...
Summary: The biggest thing that I did not expect as I have stayed at ramada's prior is that the rooms were accessible from the outside, not inside.
The rooms were decently clean, the area was very nice and the continental breakfast was decent.  It is a few blocks from Knotts Berry Farm so that is fun!
It was ok for the age of the hotel==the breakfast ==no comment.I know you have terms or poilices,but we had an emergency and had to leave.sad no refund or a cut rate another time we stay

Rooms were nice, however I had requested a bottom floor room when making reservations.  This request was no fulfilled and the front desk clerk gave no consideration to this upon check-in.  I'm 7 months pregnant so lugging my two small children and our luggage up the stairs was absolutely horrid.  Small bfast area.  Very bland selection.  Decently priced.

My wife and I had a 3 day seminar to attend in Anaheim...we didn't want to spend a bunch of money to just sleep. Needed something away from Disneyland due to fireworks and noisy kids, so we found this hotel.  Area driving up was not the greatest and I thought the wife was going to kill me...but easy parking, the pool and spa were nice, the room was clean with a Roman tub, the bed and pillows were comfortable and we slept great! The breakfast was continental, they offered hot waffles, but needed oatmeal ?? The only thing was the hot water temperature was lukewarm when turned full hot. Only 6 miles from Disneyland and two nights for what it would have cost for one night on Harbor Blvd.

It was in a great location at a great price. A lot for the money, like fridge, micro, coffee maker, and more.   It is a great facility that can be a lot better with a little bigger dining room. It is always busy and lots of customers, but it has a bigger waiting area that is wasted space... expand the dining room and make the waiting area smaller... you will benefit from it.
Paid 57$ per day and expect what you paid for .If you are not planning to stay in room for less time this hotel is worth. Lot of running kids around . Room service is ok

Summary Heading: We have a large family and needed 2 rooms between the 8 of...
Summary: We have a large family and needed 2 rooms between the 8 of us, when we got back to the hotel  at midnight we were locked out of one of our rooms for approx 45 min. The bathrooms had poor drywall repairs done in the walls and clg that were not painted. Also there were not enough towels.

Our room was made up only 2 of the 4 nights. One night it was not made up until after 7pm! Always a problem trying to get clean towels. No clean cups given in the room after the first night. Bathtub did not look very clean. The Hot Tub's water was brown/yellow. We were on the ground floor and it was very noisy.

The Hotel offers good amenities, and the discount church group fees were excellent, the only thing I noticed is that the bathroom toilet bowl is old and too low, the sink outside the bathroom is also old style and the water was slow to drain. I notified the lobby attendant., the Internet Wi-Fi service was a bit too slow, but overall it was a good stay.

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: When we arrived we were surprised as to how run down the building looked.  The only highlight of the hotel was the Ramada sign. The front desk associate was friendly& welcoming!  Our room had a foul smell & the mini refrigerator wasn’t working.  We called the front desk & they immediately switched out the fridge from the room next door, which I noticed had a foul smell as well.  We were there for Knotts, Hollywood, beach so we pretty much only slept in the room.  Housekeeping was great!  We had to open the window each night to allow the room to air out.   The pool was well kept & the complimentary breakfast was tasty.  This hotel is ok to stay at if you plan on being out all day.  Kudos to the housekeeping and front desk crew!!

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay and cheap rates!
Summary: We stayed at Ramada Anaheim West for our family trip. We enjoyed our stay at Ramada. Both rooms were clean, stocked with towels, pillows and blankets and everything that we need. The front desk was very helpful and very friendly. The area was nice, not scary or anything like other people said. Breakfast was good, we enjoyed the waffles, fruits and pastries as well as hot and cold beverages. We are definitely going to stay at Ramada the next time will be in town. Thank you so much Ramada Anaheim West Staff for giving such great customer service.

We had a different experience to many of other reviews below. We found the room to be very clean, parking easy, staff courteous (but not overly friendly) and the breakfast adequate (bagels, cereal, some fruit and waffles). We had a long day at Disneyland so we only stayed at the property for about 9 hours in total, but we slept well. I'm sure you can find nicer and better located places in Anaheim, but we were happy to stay off a major road to start our journey to San Diego the next day. All in all, very adequate for a room that cost US$75.82 for one night.

Just want to thank you for your GREAT service and very good price. We are part of LSM (Living Stream Ministry) and we have been staying at your motel for a number of years, we are there usually the first week of July and the Last week of December during our Summer and Winter bi-annual trainings But we also have different 2-3 day conferences throughout the year.  This time I stayed at room 123.  We appreciate so  much your GREAT service to all of us, your rooms are always shining and the price hard to beat.  My only recommendation is this: If you can improve the speed of your WiFi internet service that would be very very helpful.  Your WiFi Internet connection was not available most of the times and when it was, it was very very slow. In this time an age we all depend on the

We wanted a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay before and after a full day at Disneyland.  We weren't too concerned about amenities  since we were going to be spending most of our waking hours at Disneyland.  For the most part, this motel did the trick.  It was reasonably priced, quiet, and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  We appreciated the complimentary breakfast both mornings.  Two things that would improve this motel:  use a different cleaning product (the one they use has a very strong scent) and provide a free shuttle to and from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Disgusting, Prostitution street, dirty, stinky, you get what you pay for. Ick.
Summary: Where do I begin? My husband solicited by a prostitute at 9 a.m in front of this place. This section of Beach Blvd has been busy with prostitution for years! Mgmt says they charge a high rate to hookers/johns to discourage their renting, but who knows? Either way, the room stunk and was dirty, 2 big gobs of hair in the bathroom found immediately upon arrival. Thin and small towels that had body hair stuck in the fibers. My son took a dip in the pool and the towel and his suit smelled of urine water. The office was cluttered and dirty. Staff was not the most personable. Asked for a piece of paper to write a note and got a torn piece that he reached into the

We loved our hotel room it was great, the staff was very professional and kind, we had no problems the continental breakfast was great, the area was very convenient. We will sure tell our friends to stay at this hotel.

Summary: About 10-15 minutes BEFORE 6 a.m. a very loud diesel vehicle pulled into the lot and seemed to take an inordinate amount of time getting parked and shut down. I pulled one of the extra pillows over my head and tried to go back to sleep. After about 15 minutes of having the window in our room actually vibrate from the noise of the diesel I got up because I also heard numerous loud voices. I was getting concerned so I looked out of our window and about 40-50 feet away was a large white scenic-cruiser type BUS! I called the front desk and tried to talk with the man that answered, "Jonathan". I asked when the heck the bus was

Stayed there for three nights.  It is an older Ramada, but my room was clean and neat.  The only problem in my room was a little bit of careless work -- tiles didn't match and caulking was careless.  I had a very good time and enjoyed the room far more than the reviews I read would have indicated.  This is on a row of motels; could an owner of one of the other motels be reviewing this one?  There was no match between the reviews I read and my experience.  Did I chance on the only good room?  I think not.

The Ramada is a great price if you are staying near Disneyland, but it is in bad condition.  The rooms are old, not the excepted level of cleanliness, and a bit sketchy.  There is a Disney shuttle route that stops right in front of the hotel, but there is not much else for this hotel to offer.  If you are looking for a place to sleep and you are not grossed out by hotel germs, then consider this place.

Stayed here for a couple of nights.  This hotel may be an economic option for enjoying Disney.  The room was relatively well-off for our family with three kids.  A microwave and fridge were a help to have a light meal.  When checked in, we have a trouble about booking, and I tried several times to ask clerks in this hotel to fix it, however, they finally couldn't.  About it, they said, "we are not the manager, so we don't have any authority to do that..."  Umm.  Fortunately I met the manager and asked him to fix it just when we checked-out...  Is it a common in the US hotels?  Anyway, without this trouble, it was a reasonably stay in our small budget.

December 26 to 30th.. Oh my God! For 70.00 plus tax. It was not what I thought it would be..Lets start the room smelled really bad. The coffee maker still had old coffee in it. The fold out couch well the springs went right though.That just the first part of it. The bathroom was very dirty. We showerd with socks on. My daughter found blood on the walls. My kids did not want to stay there but everything was booked. On kid she used her t-shirt on the pillow case and I slept on top the bed. We did not allow housekeeping in, did not want anything to be stolen. The loby was really dirty and dust everywhere seems they did not know what a mop was for. The housekeep staff did not used soap and water to clean the room. I don't thing they even own one. One person got a room get this they

This hotel should be remodeled a long time ago. The bath tub suppose to have spa...NOT WORKING The drain  NOT WORKING It is a disguisting room. Area of the hotel is RED district. HOOKERS are in the other rooms....

Stayed for a week and never felt welcomed.  Night staff was good.  Day staff needed some training on how to interact with customers; (I think he was new.)  I don't ever plan to stay here again.  But I've had positive experiences at other Ramadas. When a place is old there are other ways to make up for it.

Summary Heading: Will do the job for an Economy Disney Trip
Summary: Stayed here for a night - hotwired for $60/night (a friday).  This is a great hotel option for someone looking for an Economy Disney Trip and you do not plan to be at the hotel often but just need a place to sleep.    We checked in late as our flight was delayed and the man that checked us in was very nice.  There was another person in front of us but the man moved through check in very quick and was courteous.  He answered all the questions I had about the park along with suggestions for times/fireworks, etc.  We were so tired, i forgot to ask what kindof room we had and we walked into our room with 1 king bed.  There were 3 of us but we were so tired, we managed fine.   The room was clean and had a fridge and microwave which would be nice if you are staying there for a few

Not impressed with the staff and less with the rooms offered.  Staff was condescending, did as little as possible to accommodate a client.  Unsure as why I was given sub-standard rooms.  I felt attitude and service were based on how reservation was made and by appearance at time of check-in.  My reservation was cancelled without my knowledge or consent due to running my debit card prior to my arrival/check-in.  Charged $10.00 more per night when I made my reservation the charge had tax & fees included) I had never had this problem booking thru this web site before.  When we arrived, there wasn't a TV in the room; we reported to the front desk immediately and they implied that we had taken the TV.

Summary Heading: Hotel is decent, if you ignore the area
Summary: I was surprised with this property.  For what I paid I expected the bottom of the heap.  The managers are clearly trying to make it stand apart from what you typically get in this price point.  Our room had two queens and a sleeper sofa which was perfect for me and 4 teenagers.  Overall, the room was reasonably clean and you can tell it had been recently upgraded.  The TV was a nice flat screen and the bathroom had tile that looked newer.  The shower head was a massaging type that actually rotated as the water came out.  There was plenty of space on the vanity by the sink for all of our toiletries.  The free Wifi connection was decent, we were all able to connect on both computers and cell phones.  We did take advantage of the breakfast, but it is minimal continental with

We just got back from a California Vacation booked through Southwest Vacations. This hotel was one of the cheaper hotels and I have to say next time we will be spending a little more money.   The hotel was cleaned everyday and I did not see any bugs coming out of the celiling :) The beds were very hard :( and they are a little noisy because the door does not shut all the way ( we had to put a chair in front of ours, so it didn't bounce:() The TV was a little fuzzy and pretty old. We didn't use the Microwave, but we did utilize the Fridge, which worked great. There was a blow dryer in the room, although I called and they said they did not have them in the rooms, so I brought my own, We did have an iron and a ironing board though.  The conitinental breakfast was not the best, but

I reserved this hotel through a Southwest package deal. Someone mentioned that the rooms were clean and updated. My room was not updated. I had an old tube tv and I had to move the cable wire and use something to hold it in place to get a good picture. When I was leaving I happened to walk by some of the other rooms and was amazed to find that the beds were in better condition and had flat screen tv's. These must have been the rooms that were "updated". I'm wondering if booking as a package deal decides what type of room you receive - that would be sad but I'm sure it happens.  The hotel is old so you have to expect that the rooms won't be like the Ritz. I had two queen beds on the 3rd floor - room 321. I was happy to see they had an elevator! The beds were hard but it didn't

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Small, outdated rooms. Hard beds. 15 minute drive to Disneyland. Free Breakfast - waffles, cereal, danish, etc - nothing special, but it was free. For the low rate I really didn't expect anything more. So for the money it is a good deal, but I think I'll pay a little more next time and stay somewhere nicer and closer.

We are annual Disney passholders so it's safe to say I frequent hotels and have stayed in many in Anaheim. (we go monthly :). This hotel was amazing!  Not sure where others have a negative experience, ours was nothing but pleasant!  Rooms were clean and updated.  Front desk manager was very accommodating.  Ask for extra towels, response was "Absolutely! Not a problem & let me know if there's anything else you need!". Breakfast was great!  Fruit, cereal, coffee juice AND waffles!  I will admit housekeeping was far from nice or friendly, however, when we brought it to managments attention we were assured it would be taken care of. We cancelled our reservation for the next

Not close to Disneyland as we had hoped but about 15 minutes away in a questionable neighborhood.  Cops were arresting a young "lady" in front of the hotel at about 11pm on a Tuesday.  Not very clean...we found stains on the sheets and a clump of hair in one of the "Clean towels"  AND...We were surprised in the morning by a 2 inch COCKROACH in the bathroom (no extra charge).  We skipped the Continental breakfast.

The room was clean, but dated.  The continential breakfast provided was decent and lobby area very nice and entertainment was optional as you watched the "ladies of the night", or day as the case may be, would walk along the street.  The staff was nice, but luckily it was the last morning, small little ants were coming out of the ceiling in the bathroom.  Although the price was very reasonable, the pool area maintained, I don't believe I would stay there again.

only downside was we were told the room slept 5 but there was only 2 double beds.so we had to pay extra for a fold down bed for our grandson.the location was in a dodgy area  with street walkers and drug dealing going on in the same roadbut no complaints about our stay very clean and good buffet breakfasts 6.30 till 10am .pool and jaccuzzi clean but on view to all passersby but didnt bother us.we really enjoyed our stay here

Summary Heading: Better then the reviews had mentioned
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and it was excellent. Very close to Disneyland. We were just there to sleep cause we were out in about but the time we were there to rest it was peaceful. The staff was helpful & friendly. The breakfast was great one less meal to buy was very satisfiying. The rooms were always clean. I am very satisfied and will be back again next year!
Manager Response: Dear Guest :     Thanks for your great reviews. By your arrival next year ,you will enjoy our new fitness room ,expanded breakfeast room area , and we promise the same great service as we provided before. see you soon.

Summary Heading: Its not as bad as others say it is
Summary: We stayed for 8 days n pretty much just slept n gone the rest of the day!! Staff very helpful n service on demand!! No swimming cause it was too cold. Rooms were always very clean when we would return. New linens bathroom clean! We first were reserved for the 1st floor but requested 2nd and they had no problem approving request we were very happy and satisfied! I was hesitant about booking here due to the reviews but with a family of 5 the price was "WOW" and we loved it!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest ,  Thanks for your kind words about the staff ,cleanliness and rooms. Upon your return ,I hope you can take the advantage of the pool ,our new fitness center and our expanded breakfeast room .Looking forward to see you again.

Summary Heading: Easy to find and helpful staff!
Summary: The hotel was clean, comfortable with helpful staff for the most part. The bathroom needed to be updated but all in all it is a good location only a 15 minute drive to Disneyland. The staff gave helpful hints on where to eat and even phoned a restaurant to find out information for us on the menu.. I felt that they went above and beyond with that. They have laundry facilities which helped as we were on the road for 2 plus weeks, they do not have soap there but you can buy that down the street.. The only complaint is that even though it is October it was hot and we had use of their outdoor pool only 1 of the 5 days as it was under repair. Other than that they do have a great deal of space to eat your continental breakfast in the morning, free intranet  and friendly staff (at least

this hotel was about 15min from disneyland,it had places to eat across the road,it was a pretty good hotel,a bit noisy with families there,kids kept running around at night past your room screaming,but it was an ok place

Left a day early on vacation.  Only place close to Disneyland that had an opening.  Very much a budget hotel.  Walked from bed to bath barefoot and my feet were black.  Toilet clogged- no maintance at night - least they had plunger that could unplug the toilet.  If you need basic service for one night it okay.  Carrow's next door had good food and didn't break the bank feeding 9 peolple.

Summary Heading: DO NOT PRE-PAY, THEY WILL CHARGE YOU TWICE!
Summary: We were quoted a cheaper rate by Ramada if we pre-paid so of course we excepted. When we checked in at the hotel the hotel clerk did not belive us, said they did not do that (he was not very polite about it). We provided the confirmation #, he called the Ramada main # and "Yes" it was confirmed, we had "pre-paid". The clerk said he still needed our card to swipe for phone calls and "stuff". Well that stuff was a second charge for the room. We have called and spoke with someone and they are "Looking into it" but it could take 7-10 days to reverse the charge. Why? It took them less than 10 minutes after we checked out to take the money. As for the room, it was a basic hotel room, clean, but the cleaners they use smell horrible. Not enoegh towels or pillows and they don't turn the

Summary Heading: I wish I had been willing to pay a little more.
Summary: Our room was really dark and the smell was unbearable.  I could not sleep for the first 2 nights.  The water pressure was so low it was impossible to feel clean after the shower.  The box spring mattresses were stained and torn.  The ceiling and tub also had dark stains.  The pool and hot tub were dirty.  The last day there we found a big pile of animal feces in the corner of the room!  Overall, a disgusting experience.  Ramada says that all of their hotels are independently operated.  Do not trust the name of the hotel.  We thought with the name Ramada it would have to meet a certain standard and clearly it did not. Front desk staff were helpful and it was close to disneyland and the local bus stops right in front.

Summary Heading: I would've rather stayed some where else...
Summary: Cleanliness:  The room was clean which is expected at any hotel but the white sheets had a lot of black stains on them, nothing gross; maybe colour? But either way thats unacceptable, people expect fresh linens when paying for a room.  Service: Front desk was okay when there was someone actually manning the desk. Most of the time there was no one ever there and they offered free breakfast in the morning and the ladies works there seemed to hate there jobs and were not happy you were there.  Location: We stayed at this hotel to visit Disneyland so the location was decent. A decent walk but a short shuttle drive away from the park.  Rooms: There was carpet being ripped up in the hallways and in the rooms, uhhh not something I'd expect from a hotel. The rooms were also a little

Okay, when we go on vacation the hotel room is just place to sleep. The room was clean (linens, bathroom, sink , etc.). They provided free breakfast as well. If you can afford to stay at the Disney hotels, by all means do so. But if you are on a budget, I would recomend this hotel.

We stayed here for four nights, loved the location, staff were very friendly and accomodating, our room was clean and serviced daily.  It is old and tired and could do with upgrading however for the price of $52 per night for four it was well worth more than this...I would recommend to budget conscious travellers...who are not expecting five star service.

Summary Heading: Not the best.....but not the worst either
Summary: Stopped here for the first 3 nights of our trip to California & Nevada. First impressions are that it's a bit scruffy but the reception staff were friendly enough.  Facilities in room = wireless internet (superb connection), microwave, small fridge, iron, ironing board, TV with poor picture quality, coffee maker, noisy a/c unit Facilities outside of room = continental breakfast, plenty of parking, easy access onto road and it had a pool & spa which were clean enough but a tad noisy and not very private as they adjoined the sidewalk of Beach Blvd Good points = room was always clean and was big enough for the 4 of us. Bad points = loose glass in window which was not very secure; only 1 extra pillow available in the entire hotel when I requested more !!!!! Would I stay there again?

Summary Heading: Cheap, old, and dirty. you get what you pay for.
Summary: the only reason I booked here was because I was using timeshare points and this was the "cheapest" (literally) I could get in the Disneyland area. Remember, you get what you pay for. It is cheap but it was good enough for us since we were only using it to bathe and sleep. I must warn you, the bed was FILTHY. I didn't realize it until when we were checking out and and pulled on the sheets to make sure we packed everything. The boxspring beneath the mattress looked like something out of a dumpster. Gross! I should've taken a picture. the bathroom was clean. The room had a small fridge and old school microwave. This definitely is a budget hotel.  They have a free breakfast everyday from 6-9 but remember, it's FREE. So expect crappy make your own waffles and watery OJ. We literally

Summary Heading: DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT STAYING HERE
Summary: A girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel on holiday and it was a VERY bad decision.  I didn't feel safe.  The rooms were FILTHY and the sheets had not been laundered.  Our room shared a door with some rather sketchy individuals.  DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT STAYING HERE

The price is ok , but the room is old and dirty.  The worst part is that there's  mouse [--] or may be dirt in between the bedsheet and blanket.  It is so uncomfortable to sleep in .  The next morning I asked the frontdesk to have the housekeeping to change the bedsheet and end up nothing has been done at all.  Later that nite the only thing they can do is to change our room for the nite.  No dirt on the bed but bad shower head , water seem to be so low that u can't really take a clean bath.  And the room is so so sosos old and have a smell.  For me I would be coming back to stay here again.  Oh, by the way the only thing that is ok is the breakfast, nothing much but quick and easy.

This was a GREAT hotel and snobby snobbs like you want to be treated like princes and princesses and it is your own fault if you booked your honeymoon and didn't get the room you wanted.  Who booked it?  I am guessing you.  The staff was SUPER friendly and the room was great.  KUDOS Ramada!

When we arrived at the hotel, I sensed that this hotel was not the best from the reception/check in desk.   This was not how the picture in the web looks.  The one and only clerk there did not even greet/acknowledge us, kept on sitting behind the counter until we had to announce ourselves.   Once we got to the room, there was an odor and the room was dark and did not have a clean appearance.  The bathroom was something else.  There were ants on the floor coming from the carpet down from the wall by the toilet.  And who would want a bidet that was not clean in appearance and you could tell that it was old.  The toilet also had ants on the seat, the rim and on the toilet tank.  The tub was made for 4 people and the shower practically flushed you down the drain.  If you have small

We went to Disneyland from April 14  -April 15, we only sleeping in the hotel, but is very nice comfortable and don't have any problems, the room is clean and the service is great. I don't have any bad thing for this hotel. Is cheap if compare with other near hotels.  I very liked.

Summary Heading: Do not waste your money & time here!
Summary: I haven't gotten a chance to experience staying there because they got my reservation screwed up and charged me as a "NO SHOW"!!!!! The management is horrible and staff does NOT know what they are doing!!! I've tried to resolve and fix this issue and left MANY messages with the manager and till this day I haven't heard from him!!!! This is a franchise hotel so once they have your money they DO NOT care about their guest!!!  Spend the extra money and stay at somewhere besides this dinky RAMADA hotel. Summary Heading: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in...ever
Summary: My husband and I stayed here in a "suite" for our honeymoon.  We actually went to the front desk to see if they had made a mistake on our room.  First, it's not a suite.  It was one disgusting, dirty room.  It was only considered a suite because it had a jaccuzi tub which always had at least one spider in it.  The carpet was held down with duct tape.  There were no batteries in the smoke detector and we were informed at the front desk that if we heard a weird noise, it was the fire alarm outside but it had a birds nest in it.  The bedspread was gross and had holes in it.  We had called ahead to make sure there was a shuttle to disneyland, but it turned out it didn't leave until two hours after the park opened.
